The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from DC Comics, a world of heroes and super villains.
176290.name: Monopoly: DC Comics

176291.name: Alfred the Great: War in the West Country 876AD
176291.description:
Mark Sheppard extends his coverage of this famous monarch with his game on Alfred’s decisive 876 campaign. Not only were the Saxon king and his followers contending with more Viking incursions, but with a rebellion among the native Britons, who sought to take advantage of the King’s woes by seeking to carve out their independence amidst the mayhem. Players familiar with the first volume of the series will be able to quickly get into this game. Each copy of Alfred the Great, Volume II is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 inch hex map
Two sheets of 286 single-sided, un-mounted counters
Three cardstock Battle Boards (one Briton, one Saxon, one Viking)
One Players’ Aid Sheet
8 pages of rules

176292.description:
Board for this game represents a modern city. CPS Ekspres is a company that drives packages to different locations around the city. Packages are represented by counters. The company has six drivers all have the information where to deliver the package. Markers are collected by stopping on marked field next to counter. Each delivered package brings one point. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.

Figurines (vans) move around the city respecting all traffic rules. The game has an educational character - playing the game, players learn the traffic rules.
176292.name: CPS Ekspres

176293.name: Schweinchen Treffen
176293.description:
There are 22 white cards which are shuffled and laid out as a board. Special plugs are used to hold the cards together. One of these cards is the Start space and all players put their pawn on that card.

There are 40 Piggy Cards. Their background colour determines which family they belong to. There are 4 families of 5 cards (so each family member has two cards.

The Piggy cards are shuffled and each player is dealt 5 cards. The remaining cards are stacked in the middle of the board. The youngest player begins.
The aim is to collect the 5 members of a family first.

Before a player begins to roll, he draws a card from the deck. Then he rolls the die, and moves his pawn. Whichever card he lands on, he must follow the instructions on it. He ends his turn by discarding a card, forming a discard stack.and shall finally again a card beside the stack. Players may never have more than 5 cards in hand at the end of a turn. The play continues in a clockwise direction. Whoever rolls a 6 may roll again.

The card-types that form the board:

A Chair:
All players need to move one place to the left and leave their cards behind. Thus everyone gets a new hand in effect. The sixth card is discarded before this happens.
Single card icon with two arrows pointing to the right:
All players are required to pass a card to the left, without having first seen the card of the right neighbour.
Paw Print:
The player has to imitate an animal of their choice. Only when the other players have guessed which animal it is. Then he may discard a card.
Die:
The player may roll again.
Two Arrows pointing left and right
All players have to change direction of play, clockwise to anti-clockwise and vice versa.
Circle:
Nothing happens.
Start Card:
All pawns start the game here. Should you land here during play, you get to roll again.
Card Hand Icon
The player draws a card from the player of his choice, and then gives any card from his hand to the chosen player.
Exchange Icon:
Landing here also lets you pick an opponent and exchange a card but this time the two cards are swapped face down.

First to get all 5 members of one family, wins the game.

176294.description: Adds 10 special ability tiles. You draw the number of players + 1 at the start of a round. In reverse turn order everybody can pick one. For the entire round you can use that special ability.
176294.name: Neptun: Queenie 1

176295.description: This expansion comes with 75 goods tiles (15 of each good type) and 6 goods point tiles. At the start of the game you place 1 good tile of each type in each city. When you deliver a certain good at a city, you take the corresponding good tile, if still present there. Once you have a set of the 5 different good tiles, you take the highest value good point tile (being worth 11 -> 6).
176295.name: Neptun: Queenie 2

176296.name: Zaljubljene podmornice
176296.description:
Zaljubljene podmornice is a very simple game for 2 to 4 players. Board has 3D elements.

Each player has one submarine. There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles that slow down the submarines. The winner is the player whose submarine first gets to the finish line.

176297.name: World War 2 Wargaming
176297.description:
Airfix Magazine Guide 15, written in an informal style, as much an exploration of how to create a wargame, and what it simulates, this small book includes all data needed for a detailed, traditional miniatures system, as well as extensive discussion on why the author made the decisions he did in it's creation. Extensive charts & tables cover point-buy options, movement rates with terrain effects, sighting ranges, armour values (with multiple locations per vehicle) and gun penetration, etc.

The chosen figure scale is 1/72 (to include 1/76), while the miniature to real life ration of 1:1 makes this skirmish scale gaming.

Illustrations through the book are pictures of miniatures and wargames in progress. Original price was £1.40!

176298.description: You get a scoretrack and each player gets a mosaic board (which depict the 15 cities on the map in a 5 x3 grid) and 15 mosaic tiles (= the 15 different cities). Whenever you fulfil a contract, you can put the corresponding mosaic tile on your mosaic board. At the end of each round, you get 3 points for a complete row and 1 point for a complete column.
176298.name: Neptun: Queenie 3

176299.name: Svemirski šetači
176299.description:
Svemirski šetači ("Space walkers") is a very simple game for 2 to 4 players. Board has 3D elements.

There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles. The winner is the player who first gets to the finish line.

176300.description: Balonijada is game for younger players. Each has one figurine. Hot air balloons fly over a bay, while flying, they should to make as many photos of birds, ships, .... In this game the most points gets the last player who reach the finish line. Each photo (counter) also brings one point. The winner is the player who at the end of the game has the most points.
176300.name: Balonijada

176301.description:
Rude Martians come to the Moon, but they don't respect traffic rules. Space patrol from the Earth comes to charge fines.

Players move figurines and collect counters by stopping on the field next to counter. The winner is the player who collects the most counters.
176301.name: Svemirska patrola

176302.name: Buntes Bilderbongo
176302.description:
The game is played rather like Lotto but has the variation of Bongo Cards. When these are revealed they add a feature to the game. For example, a player who was very far behind, could now be the the frontrunner at once and the former leader drops back to 2nd place. There are 10 different Bongo Cards and once used they go out of the game.

The game is played over a pre-set number of rounds. The one with the most matches after that time has won the game.

176303.name: Ulična trka
176303.description:
Ulična trka (Street race) is a very simple game for 2 to 4 players. Board has 3D elements.

Each player has one car. All cars drive around a city. There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles that slow down the cars. The winner is the player whose plane first gets to the finish line.

176304.name: Trka oldtajmera
176304.description:
Oldtimer race is a very simple game for 2 to 4 players.

Each player has one oldtimer car. All cars drive around the city and collect counters by stopping on field next to it. The winner is the player who collects the most counters.

176305.description:
Skate girl is a very simple game for 2 to 4 players. Board has 3D elements.

Each player has one figurine and move it along paths. There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles. The winner is the player who first gets to the finish line.
176305.name: Skate girl

176306.description:
We all know that conspiracies are real. They are trying to clone Hitler, role-playing is actually devil worship and the Reptilian overlords are watching our every move! The problem is that for some reason people ignore these obvious facts. That has to change, and quickly before it's too late!

Conspiracy! is a game for two to four players. During the game players reveal conspiracies, each of which grant the player some special power. Additionally, players can work to discredit the insane conspiracies of other players (what nut jobs!) by leaking stories to the tabloid press. Points are scored for the conspiracies left at the end of the round and those that are accepted possibly true by the public double in value.

The game ends when a player crosses one hundred points. The highest score wins.
176306.name: Conspiracy!
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game of Crowd Funding Diane Sauer Interview 02-03-2016
Vox Republica 109: Planning Conspiracies With Shoot Again Games

176307.name: Disco girl
176307.description: Four girls want to dance with boys in discotheque. Players move figurines along paths and collect counters by stopping on field next to it.

176308.name: Finish Line
176308.description:
Can you outmaneuver the other players and control the finish?

Finish Line is a simple game of moving cars from start to finish. Except everyone is moving every car, and everyone is trying to get the cars to finish in a different order.

On a turn, a player can move up to five cars one space, or remove a stop sign from the board. Optionally and in addition, a player can place a stop sign, or use one of a limited number of "shift chips" to move a car, move a stop sign, or draw a new Finish card. The goal for each round is to get as many cars as possible to finish in the order on your Finish card. The goal of the game is to be the first to have 10 cars finish in the order on your card.

The dynamic of Finish Line changes depending on the number of players, so that an effective strategy for a two-player game might be of no help at all in a four-player game. Adaptability is key.

176309.name: Astronauts And Ancients
176309.description:
From publisher blurb:


TWO NEW RACES FOR YOUR OLD SCHOOL CAMPAIGN!

EXCITEMENT!!! ADVENTURE!!! POCKETMODS!!! EXCLAMATION POINTS!!!

PROBE DUNGEONS as an extra-terrestrial GREY, or SNEER AT THE YOUNGER RACES as scion of the ancient, cobra-headed SERPENT FOLK!

BOTH the GREYS and the SERPENT FOLK are magic-oriented, with SPELLBOOKS BURNED ON THEIR BRAINS!

IVANHOE UNBOUND is PROUD to present these TWO NEW RACES for SWORDS AND WIZARDRY WHITEBOX or ANY OTHER OLD SCHOOL GAME based on the 1974 three booklet version of the WORLD-FAMOUS RPG whose name rhymes with "TRUNCHEONS AND FLAGONS!"

AND SPEAKING OF BOOKLETS, this supplement comes in POCKETMOD FORMAT. Print out a SINGLE PIECE OF PAPER which can be TRANSFORMED with FOLDS and a single cut into a TINY EIGHT PAGE BOOKLET with EVERYTHING YOU NEED to use these two races in your OSR game!

Plus, while THE TINY BOOKLET IS ADORABLE, there's also a couple of larger-size versions so you can KILL MORE TREES!

And as a SPECIAL BONUS, the actual supplement doesn't use EXCESSIVE CAPITAL LETTERS!

176310.name: Buffoons And Blasters
176310.description:
From publisher blurb:


THREE NEW CLASSES AND FIVE "MAGIC" ITEMS FOR YOUR OLD SCHOOL CAMPAIGN!

EXCITEMENT!!! ADVENTURE!!! POCKETMODS!!! EXCLAMATION POINTS!!!

IVANHOE UNBOUND is PROUD to present its LATEST SUPPLEMENT for SWORDS AND WIZARDRY WHITEBOX or ANY OTHER OLD SCHOOL GAME based on the 1974 three booklet version of the WORLD-FAMOUS RPG whose name rhymes with "TRUNCHEONS AND FLAGONS!"

Do you like a little HUMOR in your games, like BOB BLEDSLAW of the JUDGES GUILD? We've got you COVERED with these THREE NEW CLASSES:

The CLOWN-MONK, able to stun people with ENGLIGHTENMENT! What IS the sound of ONE HAND CLAPPING?
The FOOLE, master of DUMB LUCK and RANDOM MAGIC! But not so-called "Chaos Magic," as you will SEE...
The HECKLER, able to INSULT opponents until they ATTACK him! LUCKILY, he has a lot of Hit Points...




Do you like a little SCIENCE FICTION in your games, like DAVE ARNESON and GARY GYGAX did?

We've got you COVERED as well, with FIVE TECHNOLOGICAL ITEMS sufficiently ADVANCED to be considered MAGIC: Blasters, teleporters, a MYSTERIOUS CRYSTAL, a peaceful pistol and DRUGS!

But wait, THERE'S MORE! This supplement comes in POCKETMOD FORMAT. Print out a SINGLE PIECE OF PAPER which can be TRANSFORMED with FOLDS and a single cut into a TINY EIGHT PAGE BOOKLET with EVERYTHING YOU NEED!

Plus, while THE TINY BOOKLET IS ADORABLE, there's also a couple of larger-size versions so you can KILL MORE TREES!

And as a SPECIAL BONUS, the actual supplement doesn't use EXCESSIVE CAPITAL LETTERS!

176311.name: Cannibals and Confusion
176311.description:
From publisher blurb:


SIX NEW CREATURES AND A CHAOS MAGIC VARIANT FOR YOUR OLD SCHOOL GAMES!

EXCITEMENT!!! ADVENTURE!!! POCKETMODS!!! EXCLAMATION POINTS!!!

IVANHOE UNBOUND is PROUD to present its LATEST SUPPLEMENT for SWORDS AND WIZARDRY WHITEBOX or ANY OTHER OLD SCHOOL GAME based on the 1974 three booklet version of the WORLD-FAMOUS RPG whose name rhymes with "TRUNCHEONS AND FLAGONS!"

Are you sick of Lovecraft? Think Clarke Ashton Smith got the short end of the stick when it comes to "Weird Tales"? Well, even if you DON'T at least we have CANNIBALS!

Four of these six ANTAGONISTS are based loosely on Clarke Ashton Smith! As for the OTHER TWO, one STRANGE CREATURE comes from authentic myth and legend, and one FOE comes from inauthentic myth and legend that I wrote last week!

WHAT SIX MONSTERS DO YOU GET?

Stats for an Avatar of Mordiggiel, corpse-devouring Angel of the DEAD!
The SKINNY on the Clergy of Mordiggiel and the way they have been CHANGED by association with their DREAD LORD!
The forbidden DETAILS of the Graedigg, half human, half FIEND, master of illusion!
The tale of the HEADLESS Akephalos, who DEVOUR MEN WHOLE when they go MAD!
The secrets of the clever Fögr, who HIDE their VUGLAR HABITS behind DISQUIETING MASKS!
And finally the TABOO-BREAKING RITUAL that will bring forth WRATHFUL EMANATIONS from a man's soul... or a Graedigg's soul.




AND THAT'S ONLY THE FIRST HALF!

Ever feel your CLERICS and MAGES need more RANDOM TABLES?

WHO DOESN'T? Well, our CHAOS MAGIC system has got you COVERED! For every ADVANTAGE, there is a DISADVANTAGE, or at least a GOAT!

But wait, THERE'S MORE! This supplement comes in POCKETMOD FORMAT. Print out a couple PIECES OF PAPER which can be TRANSFORMED with FOLDS and a single cut apiece into TWO TINY EIGHT PAGE BOOKLETS with EVERYTHING YOU NEED!

WAIT, did I say TWO booklets? Yes, there was so much to write about these MONSTERS and the DREAD ARCANA of CHAOS ITSELF that no amount of EDITING could hold it in! So we had to split the information into TWO BOOKLETS! And for only THREE CENTS MORE!

Plus, while THE TINY BOOKLETS ARE ADORABLE, there's also several larger-size versions so you can KILL MORE TREES!

And as a SPECIAL BONUS, the actual supplement doesn't use EXCESSIVE CAPITAL LETTERS!

176312.name: Rolerijada
176312.description: Girls ride rollers through a park and collect flowers. Bouquets are represented by counters. Players collect counters by stopping on field next to counter. The player who collects the most is the winner.

176313.name: Moto kros
176313.description:
Moto cross is a very simple game for 2 to 4 players. Board has 3D elements.

Players move figurines in direction of paths. There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles that slow them down. The winner is the player who first gets to the finish line.

176314.description:
Watch out, shark! is a very simple game for 2 to 4 players.

Divers have task to take photos of see animals, but they have to be careful of sharks. Players collect counters than represent photos by stopping on field next to it. The player who collects the most is the winner.
176314.name: Pazi, ajkula!

176316.description:
Description from the package:

Sail and fight with HMS Victory, Lord Nelson's flagship at Trafalger, the most famous First=rate ship-of-the-line in the Royal Navy.

This Sails of Glory Ship Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, compatible with other Sails of Glory-Napoleonic Wars game product.

In each pack you will find all you need to play with the ship: a special base with gaming statistics, a ship card, a ship log and a specific deck of maneuver cards. Includes Captain Cards for Richard Howe and Horatio Nelson.
176316.name: Sails of Glory Special Ship Pack: HMS Victory

176318.description:
Description from the package:

Sail and fight with USS Constitution, "Old Ironsides", the most famous of the six heavy frigates representing the birth of the US Navy.

This Sails of Glory Ship Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, compatible with other Sails of Glory-Napoleonic Wars game product.

In each pack you will find all you need to play with the ship: a special base with gaming statistics, a ship card, a ship log and a specific deck of maneuver cards. Includes Crew Cards, and Captain Cards for William Bainbridge and Charles Stewart.
176318.name: Sails of Glory Special Ship Pack: USS Constitution

176319.name: Plaža
176319.description:
"The beach" is simple game for children.

Players move figurines along paths. There are several paths that are intertwined. Players collect counters by stopping on fields next to counter. The winner is the player who ends up with most points (counters).

176320.name: Androids, Aliens, and Aberrations
176320.description:
From publisher blurb:

EXCITEMENT!!! ADVENTURE!!!

Over TEN NEW RACES for MUTANT FUTURE...

EIGHT New Classes for LABYRINTH LORD...

And a TERRIFYING BONUS MONSTER!!!

This is a supplement for Mutant Future, Labyrinth Lord, and other old-school games based on a pre-1989 edition of a well-known fantasy role playing game that rhymes with "Truncheons and Flagons."

Here's what you get:

Eleven New Races for use with Mutant Future, including genetically engineered humans (Enhanced Humans, Psions), dangerous warbots (Ender, E9000), and awesome aliens (Grey, Reptoid). If that isn't enough, we've got crossbreeds (Evolved Human, Serpent Noble) and even weirder things (Goliath, Loonar, Rotter)!
Eight New Racial Classes for Labyrinth Lord™ and similar old-school roleplaying games, based on most of the races already mentioned.
One adorable, but dangerous, bonus monster for Mutant Future™, Labyrinth Lord™ and similar old-school roleplaying games.

176321.name: Holy Island
176321.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 4-6 characters of level 3.

Shipwrecked on an island though not because of bad weather or a hostile sea but because something massive came out of it and smashed the ship to pieces.

What on earth was that thing, and what’s so important about this island that no one’s supposed to leave it?

Why is the whole place teeming with divine servitors almost as if every god wishes to have a representative here, and what on earth happened to the civilisation that used to once call this place “home”?

Most importantly of all: How are you supposed to get away?

Four Dollar Dungeons are standalone adventures designed to be logical, entertaining, challenging and balanced, and easily integrated into any campaign world.

Each adventure has enough material to last three or more playing sessions and enough experience to raise four characters of the appropriate level up by one extra level. Treasure is commensurate with the encounter challenges faced. Scaling information is included for adventuring parties of five or six.

This adventure is set on the island of Serafina, somewhere …

The adventure also contains optional Psionic elements with all of the relevant rules present within.

176322.name: Triton
176322.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

176323.name: Phoenix Lily
176323.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Gardens is a series of short PDF documents that each feature a brand new plant monster to use in your Pathfinder roleplaying game or OGL campaigns. In addition to a new monster, each volume will also feature supplemental material such as equipment, hazards, ailments, feats or spells that all involve the theme of plants or nature. In this volume we present the fiery Phoenix Lilly along with two new nature related magic items; rules for natural items and how to harvest them; four natural items; and rules to use natural items as power components for spells.

176324.name: The Unchosen Ones
176324.description:
Nutshell

Members of a doomsday cult grapple with their faith and identities when the end of the world doesn’t live up to expectations.

176325.name: The Earth Wars Saga: Galactic War
176325.description:
The galaxy is slowly falling into chaos. The UNE and the Akoran Empire are fighting a bitter war over centuries old claims. The Decoran Republic has been stabbed in the back by the Andromedan Empire and the Federation Commonwealth is launching suicidal Crusades in all directions. The Horloth have been drawn into the conflict and the Ilin are close to declaring war on the UNE. With the Adromedans once more at war other races have grown nervous and have mobilized their militaries. The Nan'Tra'Ki are powerless to stop the spread of conflict and war. The fate of an entire race rests in your hands. Who will you fight for?

Galactic War is a star ship combat game set in the Earth Wars Saga universe in the year 3565. The game comes with an history of both the galaxy and humanity. There are 13 pages of rules and five fleets detailing over 100 ships, patrol boats, and fighters.

176326.name: Bathroom Simulator
176326.description:
User Summary

Explore the confined spaces of bathrooms, such as:


Home Bathroom
Filthy Subway Bathroom
Space Shuttle Bathroom
Upscale Hotel Bathroom
Porta Potty (with a line outside)


Every bathroom has its own unique objects and things to interact with.

176327.name: Tales from the Borderlands - Episode 2: Atlas Mugged
176327.description:
The group attempts to learn more about the Gortys Project while on the run from Hyperion, August, and ruthless bounty hunters.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tales from the Borderlands", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

176328.name: Sheriff of Nottingham: Tabletop Trophy of Awesome
176328.description:
Tabletop Trophy of Awesome is a single card worth 11 gold with a penalty of 5.

The promo was given out during Tabletop Day 2015

boardgamecompilation: Dixit: "The Werewolves of Miller's Hollow: The Pact" Promo Cards
176329.description: This promo pack was released as part of Tabletop Day 2015. It includes two cards, "Moon-girl", which was included previously as part of the "Werewolves" promo pack. The other, "Witch's brew", is new to this pack.
176329.name: Dixit: Tabletop Day 2015 Promo Pack

176330.name: Reverse Charades: 2015 Tabletop Day Edition
176330.description:
Reverse Charades flips the charade standard of one person giving clues to a large group on its head by splitting the players (six or more) into two teams, then having all but one person on a team work together to get that one person to guess as many words as possible in sixty seconds. Each guessed word is worth one point; each word spoken or mouthed costs that team a point.

After each player has guessed once, the team with the most points wins.

This version was given out during Tabletop Day 2015 and consists of 51 double-sided cards, a rule card, and 2 cards promoting other USAopoly games. (no box)

boardgamecompilation: Firefly: The Game – Big Damn Heroes Promo Cards
Firefly: The Game – Mal's Pretty Floral Bonnet Promo Card
Firefly: The Game – Wash's Lucky Dinosaurs Promo Card
176331.description: Seven promo cards: Big Damn Heroes, Mal's Floral Bonnet, and Wash's Lucky Dinosaur.
176331.name: Firefly: The Game – Card Pack

176332.description:
Life is tough when you are a mad scientist trying to resurrect the dead.
Body parts are hard to find, your hired help is unreliable, reanimating lifeless corpses makes your electricity bills skyrocket and those nosy police officers just keep showing up...!

Neck-Back-Toe reimplements the classic game of Tic-Tac-Toe as a solo card game. Every round, nine action cards are laid out in a grid. The player chooses one action at a time, but when three actions in one row on the grid have been taken, the round ends.

Dig up the body parts you need, suture them together and give them life! Then sell your "creations" on the black market before the police catch on to your plans. Hurry! Your reputation at the Mad Scientist Seminar is at stake!
176332.name: Neck-Back-Toe

176333.name: Riss in der Zeit
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
176333.description:
user summary

A small adventure in two parts for 2015's Gratisrollenspieltag. The first part has been written for the fantasy setting of Midgard while the second part is set in England during the late 19th century and played by the rules of Midgard 1880. In both parts the characters face the same menace in form of a demon goddess.

boardgamecompilation: Im Wandel der Zeiten: Das Kartenspiel
176334.description:
Technology is a double-edged sword.

We have grown accustomed to the comforts of civilization, but at the same time we are always creating bigger bloodier methods of destruction.

Will you focus on civil developments to speed up production, or will you build powerful armies to lay waste to your enemies?
Do you build wonders that leaves a permanent heritage for mankind, or do you want to seize it from those who are not worthy?

Guns & Steel combines the variety of hand building with a unique card flipping mechanism, and enables 2-4 players to compete throughout the ages, struggling to build the greatest empire of the world.

Enjoy a tightly packed strategy game that will force you to make challenging decisions on every turn, and experience the rise & fall of nations in just an hour's time.


Turn Overview


Resource Phase
Play a card face-down as a resource card.

Development Phase
Play a card face-up as a development card.

Purchase Phase
May buy one card from supply.

End of Turn Phase
0 or 1 card in hand:
Check if you can gain a wonder.
Retrieve cards to hand.

2 or more cards in hand: Do nothing.



Game ends when all wonders are taken, or when all Space age cards have been bought.
The player with most VP on their cards win the game.
176334.name: Guns & Steel
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 28:  HeavyCon 2016 Recap - Jon Gilmour Interview
The Game Pit: Episode 51 - Treasure Hunt Essen 2015 Part 3

176335.name: MesterQuiz
176335.description:
MesterQuiz is a Norwegian quiz game for 2 to 6 players or teams.
From a total of 16 different categories, each player selects nine categories during the game.

176336.name: Through Ningauble's Cave
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
176336.description:
[From the back of the module]

Tread in the footsteps of the legendary Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser!

Through Ningauble's Cave is the first release in the Dungeon Crawl Classics link of Lankhmar supplements. As we build toward a large boxed set, this "first look" sourcebook provides DCC RPG judges with all the information needed to journey to the world of Nehwon, Home of Lankhmar, the fabled city of the Black Toga.

Through Ningauble's Cave details the secrets of Ningauble of the Seven Eyes. It includes rules for using him as a patron, as well as information on his fantastic cave that touches multiple worlds.

176337.name: MONOPOLY: Béziers
176337.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Béziers, in France.

176338.name: Monopoly: Millau Aveyron Coté Sud
176338.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the region of Millau Aveyron Coté Sud, in France.

176339.name: Monopoly: Lozère
176339.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the region of Lozère, in France.

176340.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Dutch province of Zeeland.
176340.name: Monopoly: Zeeland

176341.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Dutch city Alkmaar.
176341.name: Monopoly: Alkmaar

176342.name: Dein Körper und Du
176342.description:
During this game, you will learn about the human body: the operation of the ear, the causes of muscle pain, the different teeth, ...

The teacher (= tiptoi pen) asks you to choose one of the 14 childrens in her class, they'll ask something and she will explain it. Afterwards, she will give you some excercises to learn about the human body.
F.e. you'll have to find the listed tooth or you have to represent a certain feeling which the other players will have to guess. Each time, you'll be doing other excercises and you'll get 1 or 2 points, depending on how good you did this game. Sometimes you'll be doing these tests by yourself, other things should be done by all players. After a few rounds, the teacher will announce how many points you scored and who won the game!

This game works with the tiptoi-pen and can't be played without it.

176343.name: LEXI Card Game
176343.description:
LEXI Card Game is a new word game. There are 55 cards in one deck of LEXI Card Game. There are 52 letter cards; the number of each letter of the alphabet in the deck is according to the frequency of usage for each letter in the English language. There are two WILD cards which may be substituted for any letter of the alphabet. There is one (shortened) Rules/Score card.

At the beginning of the game, the players set a goal of whatever score to be reached to win. (The winning score may be 100, 200, 500, etc.) Every player takes turns dealing. All players get nine cards each at the beginning of the game. One card is flipped open next to the deck, and both are placed at the center of play. The first player draws from either the deck or the opened card, but not both. He may lay down one or more words to be scored at the end of the round; he does not have to lay down any words. When this player is done, he discards one card. Play moves to the next player. All players will take turns playing. When it is a player's turn, he either draws one card from the deck or pick up card(s) from the open discarded pile. If the player draws from the discarded pile, he has to pick up all the cards from the card he wants to the latest discarded one and take it (or them) into his hand. This player has to play the bottom (oldest discarded) card he picks up and spell a word with it. He can, but does not have to spell words with the rest of the letter cards he picks up. When this player is done laying down words in front of him, he must discard one card. A player may add to an existing word he has laid down in a previous turn--by adding a prefix or a suffix--to form a longer word. For example: A player has laid down "ALL" in one turn, and has "E", "R" in his hand. In a subsequent turn, he picks up "T". This player may add to the existing word, "ALL" and form "TALLER". A player may only play and add to his own words and no one else's. For words to count toward a score, the words must be laid down in front of the player during his turn. If the words are not laid down when the round ends, those letters (forming a word) left in a player's hand will not count toward scoring. Moreover, one (1) point will be deducted for every letter left in a player's hand. All players must have taken at least one turn to spell words before the round may be ended. Only the player whose turn it is may end the round. To end a round, a player must use all his cards to spell one or more words, except one which must be discarded. Scores are added up according to the Summation principle:

1 letter word = 1 point; 2 letter words = 1+2= 2 points; 3 letter words = 1+2+3= 6 points; 4 letter words = 1+2+3+4= 10 points; 5 letter words = 1+2+3+4+5= 15 points; 6 letter words = 1+2+3+4+5+6 =21 points, etc.

The players play a new round and add up the scores. Rounds are played until the set score is reached. The first player to reach the set score wins.

176344.name: X-plorers Advanced Combat
176344.description:
From publisher blurb:

The full advanced Combat rules by the creator of X-plorers RPG! These rules are a direct reprint from the now out of print Galactic Troubleshooters magazine #1.

"The rules presented in the X-plorers core rule book are kept purposely simple. It is the author’s opinion that they give you everything you need to run quick and descriptive combats and get back to the story part of the mission. An experienced referee should have no problem using his good judgment and the context of those rules to deal with situations that aren’t specifically covered.

Still, there are going to be some who aren’t satisfied with the guidelines as written. There are also going to be some referees who feel that they need more strict structure and consistent modifiers for situations that will come up time and time again.

What are presented here are totally optional rules classified as “Advanced Combat”. It builds off of the core X-plorers combat system, but simply predefines things a referee would usually decide himself (mostly modifiers), and provides some options for people who want more detailed combats."

176345.description:
So, you're one of the cats in the back yard and the birds out there are all yours! All you have to do is play your cards right and best those other cats!

The cats all start with the same cards: 1 Catch, 2 Stalk, 1 Play, 1 Steal, 1 Taunt, and 1 Eat. No luck of the draw here, it's entirely up to you! Get as many enjoyment points as possible and win the game! Be clever and anticipate what the others will do so that you can claim victory. Each player will target another cat and a location where a bird is hanging out. They will then select their actions for the 2 rounds of action. All of the cards are revealed simultaneously, they get resolved and when the smoke clears, some cats may have birds and some may not.

The birds will hang out at the bird bath, in the grass, on the fence or in the trees. The bigger birds will need to be stalked before catching them and you will have to time everything just right. Once you do catch your bird you will have a choice to either press your luck and play with the bird to double its enjoyment point value or to just eat it. The longer you play with it the greater the chance of it being stolen by another cat.

Taunt cards allow other cats to distract you and cancel your actions, nothing is safe in this back yard!
176345.name: 'FLIP' the Bird & Cat Game

176346.name: Once Upon an Encounter: The Scorpion and the Frog
176346.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inspired by classic fairy tales and fables, the Once Upon an Encounter series gives gamemasters quick encounters that can be inserted into any adventure or campaign. The Scorpion and the Frog is designed for a party of adventurers of 2nd or 3rd level.

A paddle-driven ferry crossing a wide river as the sun rises.
An insane alchemical bomber who has gone too long without listening to the voices in his head.
When the bombs go off and the ferry begins to sink can the party prevent the bomber from taking the crew and passengers with him to the bottom of the river?

176347.name: Oubliette (Issue 9 - Spring 2015)
176347.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oubliette is back! In a new compact format. Print versions are also available from the Oubliette blog and the Squarehex website.

Written for Labyrinth Lord, but also ideal for use with any Basic/Expert/Advanced original or clone, with little or no adjustment required.

Full Contents:

Tales from Hell
Editorial
The Fella in the Cella
Book of Lost Spells
Found Familiar The Bat
These Boots Were Made for...
Monster Club #17 Titanoboa
Pool of the Titans
D20 Hit Point String Generator

176348.name: Arcana Journal (Issue 71 - Apr 2015)
176348.description:
From publisher blurb:

The true wonders of Arcana are explored in the monthly journals. Each issue focuses on a hex within the game world, offering rumors, hidden lore, and detailed descriptions of all the important sites and people of that area. Full color maps (also offered in print-easy black and white) are provided on the hex itself, plus all sites of worthwhile note, such as towns and major adventure sites. Floor plans of castles and other location are also offered.

In addition to this detailed write-up of the hex, each issue will also focus on other aspects of the game world, its history, important people, the Magi and gaming classes. When you add it all up, these journals take the mundane and make it magical. It is through the journals that the Arcana game world will grow, expand, and become a living place of adventure.

This issue of the Journal will cover the following aspects of the game world.

House Ashmorg
School of Necromancery
Herbs of the Northlands

176349.name: The Perspective (Volume 2, Issue 3 - Apr 2015)
rpgissuearticle: The Ethical/Unethical Use of Magic Versus Character Alliance
176349.description:
From publisher blurb:

Taken a bit longer to get this one to out to you!

Presents the revision of the opening for Character Value system
On the Sky-Ships of Sutlharia [reprint]
Creature Feature

176350.name: The Spire (Issue 0 - Spring 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Introduction to the Winter’s Stone Setting
176350.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to The Spire online magazine, which we hope will be your premier adventures periodical for the 5th edition of the world's most popular role-playing game!

Here are just a few of the reasons we'd like you to give The Spire your time and attention:

A regular dose of 5th edition adventures! Currently, there is a dearth of adventures for 5E. While previous editions were supported by printed magazines, those days are over, leaving a void that many gamers feel. Although we're unable to resurrect dead magazines, we can offer something new that fills a similar niche. The adventures that fill the pages of The Spire will form campaigns that will unfold over time, though each adventure will also be designed to stand alone just as well, with little or no modification.
At the helm, we have veteran game designer, Darrin Drader, co-author of the 3.5 Book of Exalted Deeds, Forgotten Realms: Serpent Kingdoms,Forgotten Realms: Mysteries of the Moonsea, D20 Apocalypse, and many, many other titles for numerous RPG publishers. He brings with him fifteen years of professional game design experience, both in the tabletop RPG and MMO industries.
The Spire is also produced by Robert Blezard, and Patric L. Rogers, both of whom have produced thousands of pages of high quality RPG material, much of it freely available over the internet.

176351.name: The Spire (Issue 1 - Spring 2015)
176351.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to The Spire online magazine, which we hope will be your premier adventures periodical for the 5th edition of the world's most popular role-playing game!

Beyond the Battlements is an adventure for first and second level characters. The XP thresholds are designed for a party of five, but can be easily modified for one less, or up to two more player characters. Reducing or increasing the difficulty of each encounter to allow for different party sizes can typically be accomplished by adding or subtracting one creature. Additionally, some groups are better optimized or have more experienced players than others, which means that some might require a higher or lower degree of difficulty than what is presented here. The best rule of thumb is to gauge how the PCs are dealing with the challenges of the adventure and adjust the number of monsters as needed.

This adventure is designed so that a party of first level adventurers will reach second level before advancing to the second floor of the barracks, which would provide too great of a challenge for first level characters, so it is important to ensure that the PCs play through a fair amount of the ground floor and Uncivilized Arendan before moving on to the final encounters of this ad-venture. In the same vein, PCs who employ wit, guile, and stealth to avoid encounters should receive ad-hoc experience awards for doing so in order for them to reach level two before attempting the second floor.

Beyond the Battlements is the first adventure in the Retaking Arendan campaign. The tale begins when the player characters take on a commission to capture the gnoll, G’aard’k Bloodsnout, who has been given command over the goblinoid forces who patrol the streets of Uncivilized Arendan. Bloodsnout is unusually intelligent for a gnoll, and possesses a keen mind for strategy, troop development, and deployment. It is believed that capturing him will allow the king’s forces in New Arendan easier access to the uncivilized portion of the city, and they will also likely learn important secrets about their enemy’s operations.

176352.name: Stoned: A Stone Snatching Game
176352.description:
STONED: A Stone Snatching Game is a card based game where the players pretend to be Cave people and try to collect more Stones than any of the other players.

On each turn a player can do only one of the following:

Take a Card (from the deck)
Take a Stone (from the bank)
Play a card (from their hand)
Throw a Stone (from their pile)

These simple but various options keeps the game fast and fun.

176353.name: Wind 'n Find
176353.description:
This is a children's board game printed on the reverse side of a Ritz Bits cracker box. It was published as a promotional item by Nabisco.

The background of the board is montage of symbols and physical objects. The players must provide tokens and a coin. Movement is based on the flip of the coin... one move for heads, two moves for tails. Players move along a winding pathway (hence the "wind" in the title) and attempt to locate (the "find" in the title) items related to summer vacation. For example, a player could land on a space requiring the kid to locate four flip-flop sandals. Other spaces require a child to discover the subtle differences between two nearly identical images.

The first player to reach the end of the pathway is declared the winner.

176354.description:
Roll for the Tournament is a quick Yatzee style DICE game about Knights competing in a Grand Tournament. Each Knight will compete in three "Events": Jousting, Melee with Swords, Melee with clubs on horseback. The winner is the Knight with the most victory points and will be crowned Tournament Champion.

Each of the three events earns the Knights victory points which will be tallied at the end to decide the Champion.
176354.name: Roll for the Tournament
boardgamepodcastepisode: PNPCAST 012: Roll for the Tournament & MAJESTY

boardgamecompilation: Neuroshima Hex! Żetony promocyjne – zestaw I
176355.description:
The Field Generator is a single tile supplement for Neuroshima Hex! and it is one of the prizes which can be acquired only by participating in Polish Championships in Neuroshima Hex 3.0 ongoing in 2015.

Controllable Token - Until under control of another token, it doesn't belong to any faction and is treated by every player as enemy's token: it blocks line of fire, cannot be moved by an own Move tile, own Modules cannot be connected to it, wounds every target within its range and vice versa, it can be pushed away, netted, taken over etc. If controllable token is connected to any unit of any faction (also HQ or Module), it immediately becomes a unit of this faction and is treated by it as its own. Controllable token is always connected with adjecent token, indicated by connection icon (identically as in the case of modules).

Enters play at the cost of 1 token from the draw - At the beginning of the game the token lies by the board and waits to be entered to the game by any player. To do it, player must additionaly discard one more token from his 3-token draw. Player then puts this token on any empty field on the board. After elimination of this token, it is again put next to the board and any player can again put it into play at the cost of 1 token from the draw.

Description of Field Generator
A Field Generator is a unit that operates continuously, irrespective of the initiative phase (similar to Nets).

Field - Field Generator affects every token within its line of fire (similar to Gauss Cannon). The effect of the Field is only Temporary Paralysis, working on a target as long as it is within Field Generator's line of fire. Temporary Paralysis deprives the target of possibility of any attack. The rest of the abilities of paralysed unit remains unchanged (Modules, Nets, Toughness, Armor etc. works normally). If the Field Generator is nobody's, then it affect all units of all players. If the Field Generator is under control of one player, then it only affects opponents units.

Rotation - When controlled by a player (see Controllable Token above), Filed Generator can be rotated in any direction by the controlling player once per his/her turn, including the turn when a controlling unit is placed adjacent to Filed Generator's connection icon.
176355.name: Neuroshima Hex! Generator Pola

176358.description:
Mini-expansion designed by Michał Oracz! Set of 6 cards - three for each player, compatible with both 2.5 and 3.0 editions.

Cards allow to change the situation on the board at critical moment, save the key unit and even keep the token for later! Huge opportunities, but remember - you can use each card only once, so you really need to think if now is the right moment...

BASE
On your turn, during drawing new tiles, you can put one of the drawn tiles on the Base card instead of mandatory discarding it. There can be only one tile lying on the Base card. During any of your following draws, you can draw this tile instead of one of the randomly drawn tiles, then you must remove the Base card from game.

MEDIC
At any time during the game, when any of your units receive wounds, you can use the Medic card. This unit is treated at this moment as if the Medic module was connected to it. After using, Medic card is removed from the game.

TACTIC
At any time during your turn, you can use Tactic card to choose one of the three following effects: Move, Battle, Push back. This card replaces corresponding instant tile. After using, Tactic card is removed from the game.
176358.name: Neuroshima Hex! Karty Taktyczne

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
176361.description:
One Night Revolution (formerly One Night Resistance) is a super fast game of secret identities for 3 to 10 players that combines all the deductive and chaotically fun elements of the One Night Ultimate Werewolf series with more structured game play. The result is a very addictive game that is easy to learn and will be played over and over again.

Every player starts with a specialist role and an ID (either Government Informant or Rebel Fighter). At night the Informants reveal themselves to one another — assuming any exist, that is, as at all player counts between zero and three Informants are in play — then all players complete their specialist action in a clockwise order (removing the need for a rigid script/app and reducing the potential to accidentally reveal your role). Specialist actions include gathering information, switching roles, and helping players in their attempt to identify the Informant(s) before the day is over. If a majority of players identify an Informant, the Rebels wins — but if the Informant(s) remain hidden, they win!
176361.name: One Night Revolution
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 006 – Top Kickstarter Games
Dukes of Dice - Ep. 62 - Rise of the Dress Lords
One Night Revolution Review

176362.name: The Undying Plague
176362.description:
User Summary

The Undying Plague has you fend off waves of attacking enemies and survive as long as possible. Weapons can be improve for money.

176364.name: Crowfall: MMO
176364.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game is announced but has not been released yet and is NOT sold yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it, nor add new releases.




WHAT IS CROWFALL?

Crowfall is a new type of online experience. We call it a Throne War Simulator, and it's a mix of a Massively Multiplayer Online Role Playing Game (MMORPG) and a large scale strategic simulator of a fantasy world.

Crowfall is different in three fundamental ways: TIME, DESTRUCTION and POWER.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgameimplementation: Godzilla Rampage: Invasion of Gamera Supplement
176366.description:
Demonic Toys vs. Blood Dolls: Battle of the Tiny Terrors Game!

Play as your favorite Tiny Terror from the popular film franchise in this classic style board game of dice rolling melee battles!

Roll the die and move your character around the game board fighting the other player's Tiny Terror’s. Use special abilities on your character’s game card to perform range or melee attacks when in battles offensively or defensively attacks against them.

How the game works: Defeat the other player's Tiny Terror’s to win. Each player (in a standard game; two players) picks 4 characters to play as. In a 3+ player game, players only choose 3 characters. Players can also choose to do a Team Battle game; two vs. two. Players work as a team controlling 2 Tiny Terrors to defeat their opponent.

Game Objective: Players choose their Tiny Terrors and battle each other till one player has defeated all of other the other player’s characters!
176366.name: Demonic Toys vs. Blood Dolls Game:  Battle of the Tiny Terrors

176367.name: Quadrifid
176367.description: Players build a four-column tower from blocks chosen based on rolling two dice. They score points after each round depending on how many columns, two to four, in the tower have equal heights. Scores are kept over multiple rounds, with the highest score, after a number of predetermined rounds, winning.

176368.name: The B.I.A. (Bovine Intelligence Agency)
176368.description:
The BIA is a game of two teams. One team are the loyal agents with the yellow agent tokens and the other team is the double agent with the blue agent chip. Players are not allowed to ever reveal their agent chips to the other players unless they are killed.

During a player's turn, the player can choose one of the available action cards to perform. Once all action cards have been used they are flipped back over and can be used again.

Loyal agents are trying to defuse danger zones while double agents want to make them happen more.

The game ends when one of the following conditions are met:
1.) Three disasters have taken place.
2.) All danger zones are gone from the board.
3.) If an agent has been killed and there are no more agent chips left.

176369.name: ASL Comp Afrikakorps: El Guettar Stakes
176369.description: The twelfth and final portion of the North Africa collection is ASLComp AFRIKAKORPS: El Guettar Stakes and it brings those pretty green American bonus counters into play with actions that all take place in Tunisia. Almost all of the scenarios depict American troops in action (a couple depict British units vs. Germans) and once again the overlay collection is used to create one interesting battlefield after another in ways that just cannot be done with geomrphic boards. This set of 8 scenarios includes the namesake Battle of El Guettar, as well as action alongthe Gafsa-Gabes road and one of the final encounters of the War in North Africa, outside the gates of Tunis.

176370.name: Io Station IV
176370.description:
The Short Pitch

Mecha pilots and their associates deal with bizarre cosmic invaders and their own personal issues at a space station just outside of Jupiter.

176371.description:
Explorers of the North Sea is set in the latter years of the Viking Age. As ambitious sea captains, players seek out new lands to settle and control. They will need to transport their crew among the newly discovered islands to capture livestock, construct outposts and fulfill various other goals. So ready the longships, there are new horizons to explore!


Gameplay Overview
Each player starts with 7 Vikings and a Longboat on a shared, central Island. From there players will place tiles and begin to venture out to the newly discovered Islands.
Proceeding clockwise from the starting player, each player takes their turn in full. On their turn, players first place 1 of their 3 tiles, expanding the game board. They can then take up to 4 actions (any number of the following):

1. Load Longship
2. Unload Longship + Deliver Livestock
3. Move Longship + Destroy an Enemy Ship
4. Move Vikings + Raid a Settlement
5. Transport Livestock
6. Construct an Outpost (costs 2 actions)

After taking their actions, players draw a new tile to their hand, ending their turn.

End of the Game
The game ends immediately after the turn where the player holding the Winter Token has no more Tiles in hand. This should be exactly 48 turns (there are 48 Tiles). Victory Points are gained from:

1. Delivered Livestock
2. Constructed Outposts
3. Destroyed Enemy Ships
4. Raided Settlements
5. Viking Deaths
6. Controlled Islands
7. Captain Cards

The player with the highest total is the winner!
176371.name: Explorers of the North Sea
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit Podcast - Episode 57: The Fury of Dracula 3rd Edition and more…
The Good, the Board, and the North Sea: Episode 61
Vox Republica 138: Havens Of Gloooooom

176372.name: A Clockwork Equine
176372.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cursed in ancient times, these ponies carry the burden of the anger of the divine, but seek to rise against it, carving out a home for themselves in the world of Everglow.

New feats, rogue tricks, alchemic discoveries, and equipment all designed for clockwork ponies!

176373.name: "H" is for "Headquarters"
176373.description:
From publisher blurb:

There's No Place Like Home

This entry in the Icons A to Z series looks at bases, hideouts, and HQs, including:

Bases as qualities, activated for advantage ... or to cause trouble!
Bases as devices, with a level and features of their own
Bases as installations, with their own abilities and qualities
Team and individual headquarters




Three different options to suit your own own Icons game and play style!

176374.name: Elemental Summoner (Summoner Archetype)
176374.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new summoner archetype. The Elemental Summoner forges a link with one of the four elemental planes, gaining an elemental based eidolon and other special abilities based on the plane chosen. This supplement also includes new eidolon evolutions, the elemental infusion templates, and tiny elemental stat blocks.

176375.name: Planetouched Feats I
176375.description:
From publisher blurb:

Planetouched Feats I brings you 12 mythic feats for your planetouched paragons of fire and earth: ifrit and oreads! Unleash your elemental power with feats from Echoes of Stone to Blazing Aura and Oread Burrower to Scorching Weapons!

176376.name: Societies and Settlements
176376.description:
From publisher blurb:

Most societies are confusing to an outsider, but in order to function they must make sense from their own perspective. Thus most societies follow certain basic rules; they protect their members (or, arguably, some of their members) and create an environment where they can fulfil their function or pursue their wishes. There is usually some form of organisational structure in place to regulate activity and prevent excessive internal conflict.

However, societies do break down, or become skewed by internal or external factors to the point where they cannot survive in the long term. There is nothing to prevent the referee from coming up with a very odd, perhaps even incomprehensible, social structure. However, there needs to be a reason for whatever set up exists, even if it is never revealed to the players.

Written by fan-favourite M J Dougherty, Societies and Settlements is an invaluable addition to the Referee's Aid series, exploring the different governments, cities and other settlements of the galaxy and discovering how they can be used to influence campaigns.

176377.name: Von Magiern und Finstren Mächten
176377.description:
user summary
The third of the Dausend Dode Drolle Abenteuerbände contains three scenarios for characters of lower ranks. Also included is a description of the Phoenix Guild in Haelgarde.

From the back of the book (in German)
VON MAGIERN UND FINSTREN MÄCHTEN
Drei Midgard Fantasy-Rollenspiel-Abenteuer
von Christopher Bünte und Carsten Grebe

Das Land jenseits
Ein Einbruch in die Krypta des Gildenmeisters Athelwyne MacAelfin stellt die Abenteurer vor ein Rätsel. Die wertvollen Grabbeigaben sind unberührt, lediglich der Schädel des Toten wurde gestohlen. Treiben Finstermagier in Haelgarde ihr Unwesen? Die Spuren der Diebe führen zur Phoenixgilde, wo die Abenteurer durch geheime Nachforschungen mehr in Erfahrung bringen, als sie eigentlich wissen wollten. Ein Strudel der Ereignisse bricht los, und die Gefährten müssen acht geben, nicht den Überblick dabei zu verlieren. Wenn sie sich anstrengen, erhaschen sie vielleicht einen Blick auf Das Land jenseits der Welt der Lebenden, wo die Toten herrschen und die Geister niemals ruhen. Verbergen sich hier die Antworten auf ihre Fragen?

Ein Kriminalabenteuer über Geister und Magier für Spielerfiguren niedriger Grade.

Im Rund der alten Götter
Der Kaufmann Ktesias Galanis ist in großer Sorge: Er vermisst seine Tochter. Nach einem Streit mit ihrem Vater ist das Mädchen spurlos verschwunden. Die Abenteurer werden um Hilfe gebeten und sollen die Verschwundene suchen - ein leichter Auftrag, wie es scheint, nicht aufregend, aber gut genug, um den Beutel mit Gold zu füllen. Die Suche nach dem jungen Mädchen gestaltet sich jedoch nicht so einfach wie geplant. Bald finden sich die Gefährten im Zwergenviertel von Haelgarde wieder, verstrickt in eine finstere Verschwörung, die einen Umsturz plant. Die Chaosgötter strecken ihre gierigen Finger nach der friedlichen Hafenstadt aus, eine dunkle Sekte treibt unter den Straßen der Stadt Im Rund der alten Götter ihr Unwesen. Eile ist geboten, wollen die Abenteurer das drohende Unheil abwenden.

Ein Kriminal- und Dungeonabenteuer über Zwerge und Götter für Spielerfiguren niedriger Grade.

Die Bestie von Wefford
Der Caladrius, ein verschollen geglaubter, mythischer Zaubervogel wurde in den Wäldern von Aettrick gesichtet. Aelfryd MacBeorn, der geachtete Lehrmeister an der Phönixgilde zu Haelgarde hat sich in den Kopf gesetzt, das magische Tier König Beren MacBeorn zu seiner Krönungsfeier als Geschenk zu überreichen. Er ersucht die Abenteurer um Hilfe, ihm beim Einfangen des kostbaren Vogels zur Hand zu gehen. In dem kleinen Weiler Wefford, wo der Caladrius zuletzt gesichtet wurde, stoßen die Abenteurer bei ihrer Jagd aber nach und nach auf verschiedene Todesfälle, die auf den ersten Blick nichts miteinander zu tun haben. Hat das überraschende Auftauchen des Caladrius etwas mit den blutigen Mordfällen zu tun? Und wie paßt die legendäre Bestie von Wefford hierzu ins Bild, die die Bewohner Nacht für Nacht in Schrecken versetzt?

Ein Kriminal- und Wildnisabenteuer für Spielerfiguren niedriger bis mittlerer Grade.

Dieser Band enthält drei Rollenspiel-Abenteuer für Spielerfiguren niedriger Grade und zusätzlich die ausführliche Beschreibung der Phoenixgilde zu Haelgarde.

176378.name: 101 Feats and Talents (13th Age)
176378.description:
From publisher blurb:

Break out of your class!

You are hereby cordially invited to a party inspired by adventurous storytelling, daring actions and dark villains. Pick one of these new options and redefine your character concept.

For Feats, a Gentleman Thief always gets treasure, can bluff his way out of almost any tight spot and will never be held for long. A skilled combatant shall Seize an Attack climb up a monster at strike at its weakest point. A spellcaster can use Freezing Spell to slow opponents or freeze liquids, in addition to normally inflicted damage. There are also options for your companions, pets, and animated icky things.

And if you want changes to be more profound, with Talents your character may exploit Infernal-Born Heritage so you can bind your bargains in blood, learn backgrounds like a genius savant with Eccentric Specialist, or just become unto some eldritch abomination with Tentacles.

For Game Masters, your monsters and NPCs can become special, too. Remember Nastier Specials? Here is over a hundred ways to make life interesting for people who think this is just another zombie, an orc, or a whale. You can make that mean mastiff possess its owner via Companion of Possession, or you can have that gambler use Invisible Spell to carefully part some PCs from their loot.

176379.name: The Green Hydra
176379.description:
User summary:

You are the only survivor of a Ratikkan trading expedition to the southern city of Suthorp. Once you arrive in the city, you are offered a mission to venture into an ancient tomb and destroy an evil hydra.

176380.name: The Crimson Sea
176380.description:
User summary:

At the beginning of the book, your character’s female companion, Ketza Kota, is kidnapped by slave traders. You must learn her whereabouts and eventually undertake a sea voyage to the land of Hitaxia in order to rescue her.

176381.name: The Fire Demon
176381.description:
User summary:

You journey to a jungle region south of Hitaxia in search of a lost city where immense power and wealth await you. Meanwhile, two powerful enemies await....

176382.name: Between the Adeptive Engine
176382.description:
Nutshell

At first you thought it was just a game, now you’re stuck in a virtual labyrinth of online worlds trying to unravel the truth of it all.

176383.name: Garam Masala
176383.description: Garam Masala is a card game, in which every player try to enhance his farming and commerce systems in order to gain money and prestige. Buying new fields and hiring new workers, players have the opportunity to yield spices and sell them at the Indian people obtaining prestige points and the chance to recover the used Action cards. The Merchant can reclaim used action cards and he can also control the goods at opponents disposal, but in the meantime the opponents will try to steal the title of merchant.

176393.description: During the Kickstarter several new Dancers and Staff members were unlocked. These were not included in the first print run and could be pledged for in the Kickstarter alone.
176393.name: Lap Dance Kickstarter Stretch Rewards and 5th Player Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Dice Steeple # 17 - The Choices We Make & Why with Special GUests Burky & Badger

176394.name: Colonial Conquest
176394.description:
Colonial Conquest (TM) is the new game from Argonauts Interactive where you have the opportunity to revive the race for the colonies and world domination that shaped the world and countries of today.

Source: The Game Website.

176395.name: Galactic Inheritors
176395.description:
GALACTIC INHERITORS is a new space 4X game from Crispon Games and published by Argonauts Interactive.

The game focuses on the science part of science fiction, strategy advanced planning and depth of gameplay.

In Galactic Inheritors, players must explore the galaxy to find its strategic choke points and colonize solar systems to expand their empire's influence. Viable strategies are diverse and range from building a massive fleet to preparing their people for war through the power of the media. In Galactic Inheritors, it's up to players to master a wide range of tactics as part of a greater strategy to conquer the galaxy by any means necessary. As one of five races, players traverse between solar systems by jump network, acquiring resources to further expand their influence and increase their empire's research, production and commercial capabilities. Uncovering the secrets of each planet and empire is pivotal in gaining dominance over the galaxy

GALACTIC INHERITORS was designed by Chris King, the former lead designer of Paradox Interactive, and is his first game since founding Crispon Games.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Board Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Gouden Ludo Best Family Game Nominee
2016 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Multi-player Nominee
176396.description:
Each player builds their own metropolis in Quadropolis (first announced as City Mania), but they're competing with one another for the shops, parks, public services and other structures to be placed in them.

The game lasts four rounds, and in each round players first lay out tiles for the appropriate round at random on a 5x5 grid. Each player has four architects numbered 1-4 and on a turn, a player places an architect next to a row or column in the grid, claims the tile that's as far in as the number of the architect placed (e.g., the fourth tile in for architect #4), places that tile in the appropriately numbered row or column on the player's 4x4 city board, then claims any resources associated with the tile (inhabitants or energy).

When a player takes a tile, a figure is placed in this now-empty space and the next player cannot place an architect in the same row or column where this tile was located. In addition, you can't place one architect on top of another, so each placement cuts off play options for you and everyone else later in the round. After all players have placed all four architects, the round ends, all remaining tiles are removed, and the tiles for the next round laid out.

After four rounds, the game ends. Players can move the inhabitants and energy among their tiles at any point during the game to see how to maximize their score. At game end, they then score for each of the six types of buildings depending on how well they build their city — as long as they have activated the buildings with inhabitants or energy as required:


Residential buildings score depending on their height
Shops score depending on how many customers they have
Public services score depending on the number of districts in your city that have them
Parks score depending on the number of residential buildings next to them
Harbors score based on the longest row or column of activated harbors in the city
Factories score based on the number of adjacent shops and harbors


Some buildings are worth victory points (VPs) on their own, and once players sum these values with what they've scored for each type of building in their city, whoever has the highest score wins.
176396.name: Quadropolis
boardgameaccessory: Quadropolis: Monument – Leaning Tower of Pisa
Quadropolis: Monument – Palais des Festivals de Cannes
boardgamepodcastepisode: #19: Viticulture on tap, Quadropolis & TableTop Day
7. Devon Dice Podcast, Quadropolis Review
Champions of Midgard
clp033 – cubelove podcast – Nations Dynasties
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 015 – Top 10 Mechanisms
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 016 – Quadropolis vs Suburbia
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 035 – Top 25 of 2016
DJ127: Quadropolis (2016) François Gandon
Episode 03: Architects & Alchemists
Episode 30: Imhotep Review + Question from a Hat
HLG 6: Samen
HLG-EXTRA 1: Zuiderspel 2016
HLG-EXTRA 2: Ducosim Jubileumbeurs 2016
MN 0133 Seven Games Reviewed in 30 Minutes - Quadralegthimotcovok
MN 0141 Holiday Gift Guide 2016
