176495.name: New Vehicles & Customizations 1
176495.description:
User summary:

A collection of new vehicles and customization options for use with Atomic Highway.

176496.name: Bull Fly & Maggot
176496.description:
From Introduction:

Bull flies are twenty-foot long horse flies known to carry people away.

176497.name: Player Musclecars
176497.description:
User summary:

A collection of new vehicles for use with Atomic Highway.

176498.name: Steel Beak & Flesh Ivy
176498.description:
From Introduction:

The steel beak, also known as the metal punch, is a 6’ tall, 15’ long flightless woodpecker, and is used as a mount by some homesteaders.

Flesh ivy uses living animals, including humans, to both transport its seeds as well as act as fertilizer.

176499.name: Atomic Highway: The Homebrewer's Guide
176499.description:
From Introduction:

Creating your own material for a game is one of the great joys of rpgs, so here are some useful guidelines for anyone who wants to create new Rearings, Pursuits, Mutations/Flaws, Vehicles, Beasts and Mutant Horrors, Humanoid Animals, and Psychic Powers.

176500.name: Goblins
176500.description:
From publisher blurb:

My first mistake was to underestimate these dark, gibbering creatures. I underestimated their intelligence, their devotion, their singular drive toward a tribal goal that supersedes the needs, or lives, of individuals. My second mistake was pride in thinking I could recover from the first mistake without a lasting reminder.

- Renwalt the Nine-Fingered

Inside this short book, you'll find information on using Goblins as a playable race for either PCs or to make an ultimate and unexpected NPC to throw against your players! Information on Goblin names, including a name generator are also included, as well as three types of Goblin sub-races!

176001.name: The World of Critical Dawn
176001.description:
From the Introduction:

An archaeological discovery at the lost colony of Roanoke awakens an alien race long buried and hidden since the dawn of time. As the invaders set about enslaving and even harvesting humans while terraforming the planet, some people collude with the aliens, while others fight a desperate resistance.

176002.name: A Cowboy on Mars
176002.description:
From the Introduction:

When Edgar Rice Burroughs published his first tale in 1912, Under the Moons of Mars, the genre of scientific planetary romance was born. Also known as sword-and-planet tales, these stories of swashbuckling heroes facing outrageous danger and finding true love on exotic, alien worlds quickly became immensely popular. With this setting chapter, you can find your own adventure as A Cowboy on Mars!

176003.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from LOSC, a soccer club in Lille, France.
176003.name: Monopoly: LOSC Édition des Légendes

176004.name: Spørgsmål og Svar
176004.description:
A card game very much like Foolish Questions, but with some differences:

The game contains one deck of cards with questions (Green) and one deck of answers (Blue). The Answer cards are dealt to all players equally and the questions are spread out on the table.

One player begins by selecting another player and draws a Question card from the pile and ask the question. The player selected then takes the top most answer card and read this.
Now (s)he pics a player, draws a card and reads the question

The game continues until there are no more Questions and Answer cards.
The one who first get rid of Answer Cards is the winner; if the game ends because the Question cards run out, the one with least Answer cards is the winner.

Possibly illustrated by Hans Quist (1922-1983).

176005.name: birdsong
176005.description:
User Summary

The winner entry for Ludum Dare 31, whose theme was "Entire Game on One Screen", birsong is a platform game in which you play as a bird who must regain its wing by taking on platforming challenges. It uses a colour palette reminiscent of the original Game Boy.

True to the jam's theme, birdsong uses a fish-eye filter so that the sizable world is indeed fully viewable on your screen at all time.

176006.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from A.S.S.E., a soccer club in St. Etienne, France.
176006.name: Monopoly: A.S.S.E. Édition des légendes

176007.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from OL, a soccer club in Lyon, France.
176007.name: Monopoly: Olympique Lyonnais

176008.name: Little Gods
176008.description:
Nutshell

Mortal rulers form their own pantheon to keep up a public pretence of being divine while engaging in intrigue and battle from behind palace walls in an effort to survive and keep followers.

176009.name: Godmind (Pathfinder)
176009.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the tenth adventure in the ZEITGEIST adventure path!

This is the Pathfinder RPG version of this adventure.

An Age of Reason. An Age of Darkness.

The Obscurati have won. Across the world, peoples' minds turn to rationality and industriousness - ideals of Nicodemus, the conspiracy's founder. But even as the Ob form a world government, strange side effects of this Great Eclipse begin to arise.

Thoughts in crowds begin to link into great hiveminds, subsuming free will and even manifesting as monsters. Ancient titans long ago subdued by the ways of magic awaken and content for their land. And the sun and the stars themselves have vanished, save for an ominous nebula shaped like two crushing gears, which grows slowly closer day by day.

Only the nation of Risur resists the Ob's control, and its people look to the heroes for salvation. Will they be able to defend their homeland and thwart the Obscurati's plans to unify all civilization, before those efforts awakan an all-consuming horror: a Godmind?

An adventure for inveterate heroes of levels 17-19.

176010.name: MonsterMore Vol. 1
176010.description:
From publisher blurb:

Even more monsters.

MonsterMore is a collection of 13 new monsters for the play-with-anyone Dungeonteller Fantasy RPG. It's a mix of fresh takes on classic monsters and new monsters you won't find in any other game.

Every page is plastered with full-color vector artwork and easy-to-grok visuals. Proportional font size for monster stats make each monster's strengths and weaknesses instantly apparent to the GM.

Monsters include: cave ape, cloud giant, three types of devil, ghast, kobold, lamia, necromancer, nimblewing, pitch dragon, spectre, and sphinx.

176011.name: Wacky Challenge
176011.description:
From the publisher's website :

With this new game of the Smart line, you are about to embark on a crazy race! During 5 turns, you will try to reach as many stopover towns as possible using the different vehicles available.

Each player has 5 cards in hand that show a vehicle and a route section with a number of steps. Each one of the players gets the 5 vehicles. A hierarchy, which will evolve during the game, indicates which vehicle is the fastest for the turn.

To begin, the players choose simultaneously a “Vehicle” card from their hand and reveal it. The player who has selected the fastest vehicle chooses first the route card that comprises the most steps, among the available ones. The other players take turn doing the same. The last player to choose his route section will be able to use his booster, which is a power specific to the pilot he controls, as a support for the following turn.

The played “Vehicle” cards become available “Route” cards for the following turn, which can now begin. You will have to plan in which order you will play your vehicles, according to your booster and the route sections at stake.

After the 5th turn, the player whose route crosses most steps wins the game.

176012.name: Hoppers, Bad-Bad Bunnies
176012.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magical Minutua are free mini- supplements and rules errata for Witch Girls Adventures.

Magical Minutua 2: Hoopers

What's easter without Humanoid Rabits with a thing for Bows and hunting?

176013.description:
¡Abordaje! ("Boarding!") is a fast, tactical two-player game of fighting to take control over the enemy ship.

The game uses a drafting card mechanism with players giving orders simultaneously to their crews and trying to anticipate which orders the enemy is going to use. During a round, each player plays five of the twelve "Boarding Cards" over the battlefield trying to maneuver with his men and get advantage over his enemy will trying to counter his actions. At the end of each of the six rounds, players check whether they have control over any enemy deck, try to capture the enemy captain if possible, and score points.

A player wins if he takes permanent control of three of the five enemy decks, exterminates the opposing crew, or if after the sixth turn he has more VP than his rival.
176013.name: ¡Abordaje!

176014.name: Fisticuffs (Modern Monks)
176014.description:
From publisher blurb:

This new version of Fisticuffs as been re-written for use with the Modern Monks Role Playing Game. It has also been re-organized for a more structured adventure, but retains many of the elements from the original version.

176015.name: Legendary Item Abilities
176015.description:
From publisher blurb:

Legendary Item Abilities is our latest Mythic Mini devoted to mythic magic items that create unique mythic effects. This product looks in particular at those items that mythic creatures can create for themselves, investing a portion of their mythic power to create an artifact and a legendary item. This product contains a quintet of new abilities for your legendary items: inestimable beauty, mighty servant, resonant regalia, soul drinker, and soul safe!

176016.name: Imperial Druid (Druid Archetype)
176016.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new druid archetype with an Oriental flavor. The Imperial Druid is an agent of the Celestial Court, responsible for maintaining the sacred places and relations with the natural and spirit world. In addition, a new Domain is introduced and two new Foo Creature templates.

176017.name: Mystic Theurge
176017.description:
From publisher blurb:

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – is about the prestige class the Mystic Theurge, the devotee of both the arcane and the divine.

Many of these feats rely on sacrificing spells to power them, but the effects can change depending of if it's powered by an arcane spell or divine miracle.

This edition includes the following feats:

Arcane Booster - Sacrifice an arcane spell to boost your divine miracles
Divine Booster - Give up divine spell energy to make your arcane spells better
Mystic Hit - Release arcane energy to increase chances of hits, divine spells make your hits more powerful
Mystic Knowledge - Granst a bonus to certain areas of knowledge
Mystic Personality - Improve or re-roll in social situations
Mystic Protection - Become tougher or harder to hit
Mystic Willpower - Re-roll or gain a bonus to will saves

176018.name: Lejends Magazine (Vol. 1, Issue 8 - Dec 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Lost Lore: Shamanism Powers and Ability, Part II
176018.description:
From the cover:

Withing the Scroll:

Shamanism: Part II

Alfar Orders: An Optional Order

Wild Rants: Mechanist Gaming

176019.name: Orbital Grand Hotel
176019.description:
From publisher blurb:

From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is a possible not so grand orbital hotel above an industrial wasteland of a world.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

176020.name: Lejends Magazine (Vol. 1, Issue 9 - Jan 2002)
176020.description:
From the Cover:

Within the Scroll:

Demonchild's Gambit
a new adventure
by Dan Cross and Brant Bollman

176021.name: Lejends Magazine (Vol. 1, Issue 10 - Feb 2002)
rpgissuearticle: A Traveller's Guide to Caer Cieniel
CAER CIENIEL: THE CITY OF SHADOWS
Lost Lore: New Powers of Theurgy
176021.description:
From the Cover:

Within the Scroll:

A Traveller's Guide to
Caer Cieniel

New Powers of
Theurgy

176022.name: Lejends Magazine (Vol. 1, Issue 11 - Mar 2002)
rpgissuearticle: Lost Lore: New Powers of Enchantment
176022.description:
From the Cover:

Within the Scroll:

New Powers of Enchangtment

Optional Orders for Alfar

176023.name: Vileheart Reavers
176023.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gruesome Gangs is an exciting Pathfinder Roleplaying Game® compatible product line providing the Game Master with a collection of non-player characters (NPCs) designed to work together from the perspective of backstory, game mechanics, or both. The groups are presented at different Challenge Ratings to increase their utility for multiple gamers. In addition, this allows player characters (PCs) to encounter one of these groups early in a campaign and then again after both teams have gained experience with minimal extra work for the Game Master!

If the entire team is unsuitable for inclusion in the campaign at the time, then NPC stat blocks can be used individually as needed. A mixed approach can also be interesting. By introducing a single foe into the campaign, this product gives a number of friends or allies that foe could call upon after running afoul of the PCs! This gives the Game Master a ready-made answer to who would the NPC go to for assistance, or even who would come to avenge his death at the hands of the PC party!

Using This Product

This product presents the overall history of the NPC team as well as the backstory for each individual member of the gang.

Each NPC has four stat blocks (CR 4, CR 9, CR 14, and CR 19) demonstrating his progression and growth over time. As a visual indicator, the color of the name bar designates which stat blocks from each NPC are of equivalent Challenge Rating along with the CR text.

Composition

Each gang is comprised of multiple members which can include a mixture of races, class levels, and templates. This section helps the Game Master compare different gangs’ capabilities and make-up at a glance without having to review each stat block.

Team Members

Arasha Manflayer – CE female orc
Grongrek the Bloody – NE male half-orc
Humgret Warhavoc – NE male half-orc
Tokrar Bileblood – CE male human ogrekin
Wyrdomel Manflayer – CE male orc afflicted wereboar




Team Summary

The Vileheart Reavers are a despicable crew of ruffians from the dregs of the population. Rejected by both civilized and uncivilized societies, the gang remains on the move earning coin through mercenary contracts, assassinations, and their own nefarious schemes. Often little more than bandits, the crew frequently runs afoul of regional leaders and the law. The Vileheart Reavers learned long ago that adventuring is dangerous work, and it is far easier to ambush other adventurers while they are wounded and recovering and take their plunder than to seek riches on their own.

The group consists of violent individuals who do not always get along. They have no moral scruples and will do anything for the right price, which for several would include betraying one another. The Vileheart Reavers are a very physical team who rely mostly on strength and brute force. Their magical aptitudes are crude, but powerful, and rely heavily on hedge magic, dark arts, and bloody rituals.

176024.name: Order of the Five Winds
176024.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gruesome Gangs is an exciting Pathfinder Roleplaying Game® compatible product line providing the Game Master with a collection of non-player characters (NPCs) designed to work together from the perspective of backstory, game mechanics, or both. The groups are presented at different Challenge Ratings to increase their utility for multiple gamers. In addition, this allows player characters (PCs) to encounter one of these groups early in a campaign and then again after both teams have gained experience with minimal extra work for the Game Master!

If the entire team is unsuitable for inclusion in the campaign at the time, then NPC stat blocks can be used individually as needed. A mixed approach can also be interesting. By introducing a single foe into the campaign, this product gives a number of friends or allies that foe could call upon after running afoul of the PCs! This gives the Game Master a ready-made answer to who would the NPC go to for assistance, or even who would come to avenge his death at the hands of the PC party!

Composition

Team Members

Akaoni – The East Wind – LE female hobgoblin
Chi Ren – The Charnel Wind – CE male ghoul
Izumi Satoru – The South Wind – LE male nagaji
Khru Thec – The North Wind – NE male human
Syaitan Darah – The West Wind – LE female tengu




Team Summary

The Order of the Five Winds is a skilled team of martial artists led by a vicious ghoul. They heavily favor melee combat with a healthy mix of stealth capability and some limited spellcasting. Predominately non-human, they often operate on the fringes of society finding work as mercenaries and enforcers for various entities unconcerned with the nature of those they employ. One of the Winds is a master of impersonating members of various religions and often leads others into ambushes after gaining their trust.

Most of the team cooperates well bound by honor, respect, or fear; however, the two monks share a growing hatred for one another that will likely lead to a betrayal. The Order’s leader is prone to bouts of unpredictability and violence, signs of his diminishing connection to his former humanity. This is often observed when the team meets setbacks. A series of well-planned and coordinated events will be punctuated by acts of extreme violence.

176045.name: Simay Niazi
176045.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cohorts & Companions – Simay Niazi provides twenty stat blocks (levels 1 thru 20) for a vishkanya sorceress who specializes in enchantment magic and poison. Whether hurling spells or firing blowgun darts, Simay whittles away opponent abilities and will to fight. She is also skilled in diplomacy, deception, and stealth, making her a versatile mixture of combat ability and social interaction. Add this sultry, serpentine spellcaster to your campaign today!

This product is Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game compatible and gives you twenty ready-to-play stat blocks for a stalwart companion at all levels, 1 thru 20! Use these stat blocks to add companions or assistants to the party when players are absent, extra muscle is needed, or mercenaries are hired. This also gives the GM the ability to have potential cohorts on hand built at any level needed.

If you find the character’s history and other story elements not to your liking, you still have twenty NPC stat blocks you can use as standalone characters of your own naming and developing or as minions and other rabble. Increase your available NPC stat blocks at every character level (Challenge Rating 1/2 thru 19).

The Cohorts & Companions series is designed to make the GM’s life easier. Each release provides numerous stat blocks that can be used immediately along a specific theme. Locate a specific kind of foe to introduce into your campaign or collect them all to build a toolbox of NPCs to unleash at any time. Give your players a new ally today!

176046.name: Delfina Ambrosi
176046.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cohorts & Companions – Delfina Ambrosi provides twenty stat blocks (levels 1 thru 20) for a half-elf cleric/monk built with the merciful healer archetype. She fights unarmed and favors nonlethal damage. She is a great addition to a party needing some additional healing options but not wanting the same cookie-cutter cleric. Her fast movement, high AC, and feat selection allows her to move around the battlefield to aid the injured with ease.

This product is Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game compatible and gives you twenty ready-to-play stat blocks for a stalwart companion at all levels, 1 thru 20! Use these stat blocks to add companions or assistants to the party when players are absent, extra muscle is needed, or mercenaries are hired. This also gives the GM the ability to have potential cohorts on hand built at any level needed.

If you find the character’s history and other story elements not to your liking, you still have twenty NPC stat blocks you can use as standalone characters of your own naming and developing or as minions and other rabble. Increase your available NPC stat blocks at every character level (Challenge Rating 1/2 thru 19).

The Cohorts & Companions series is designed to make the GM’s life easier. Each release provides numerous stat blocks that can be used immediately along a specific theme. Locate a specific kind of foe to introduce into your campaign or collect them all to build a toolbox of NPCs to unleash at any time. Give your players a new ally today!

176047.name: Thorkatla Foamflagon
176047.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cohorts & Companions – Thorkatla Foamflagon provides twenty stat blocks (levels 1 thru 20) for a dwarven cleric built with the forgemaster archetype. She has a mixture of abilities allowing her to wade into melee, provide healing support, engage enemies from a distance, and build and enhance weapons and armor. Supplement your party with this master metalsmith today!

This product is Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game compatible and gives you twenty ready-to-play stat blocks for a stalwart companion at all levels, 1 thru 20! Use these stat blocks to add companions or assistants to the party when players are absent, extra muscle is needed, or mercenaries are hired. This also gives the GM the ability to have potential cohorts on hand built at any level needed.

If you find the character’s history and other story elements not to your liking, you still have twenty NPC stat blocks you can use as standalone characters of your own naming and developing or as minions and other rabble. Increase your available NPC stat blocks at every character level (Challenge Rating 1/2 thru 19).

The Cohorts & Companions series is designed to make the GM’s life easier. Each release provides numerous stat blocks that can be used immediately along a specific theme. Locate a specific kind of foe to introduce into your campaign or collect them all to build a toolbox of NPCs to unleash at any time. Give your players a new ally today!

176048.name: Roland Talbot
176048.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cohorts & Companions – Roland Talbot provides twenty stat blocks (levels 1 thru 20) for a human fighter built with the polearm master archetype. He fights with a glaive-guisarme and has a variety of skills to make him a great supplemental companion or cohort in a party needing additional melee combatants. His reach weaponry adds versatility to the party, and his feat selection allows him to help control enemy movement on the battlefield.

This product is Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game compatible and gives you twenty ready-to-play stat blocks for a stalwart companion at all levels, 1 thru 20! Use these stat blocks to add companions or assistants to the party when players are absent, extra muscle is needed, or mercenaries are hired. This also gives the GM the ability to have potential cohorts on hand built at any level needed.

If you find the character’s history and other story elements not to your liking, you still have twenty NPC stat blocks you can use as standalone characters of your own naming and developing or as minions and other rabble. Increase your available NPC stat blocks at every character level (Challenge Rating 1/2 thru 19).

The Cohorts & Companions series is designed to make the GM’s life easier. Each release provides numerous stat blocks that can be used immediately along a specific theme. Locate a specific kind of foe to introduce into your campaign or collect them all to build a toolbox of NPCs to unleash at any time. Give your players a new ally today!

176049.name: Friendship Is Tragic
176049.description:
From the Publishers webpage:

New free Shadowrun adventure released! Line developer assumed drunk

By jhardy | Published: April 1, 2015


[Note that this blog post is being dictated, as Mr. Hardy felt typing posed too great a challenge.]

I don’t … I just can’t … there’s ponies. Ponies and Amish. And they’re all thrown together and statted out. Statted! Stats for ponies!

The world used to make sense to me. Mr. Johnson … he wore a suit. And he screwed you over good, and you took it! And yeah, there was gunfire and grenades and spells raining down all over, but it all worked! But now, now you kids with your Tumbles and your Instant Grahams and your, and your …

[unintelligible]

… couldn’t hold a candle to even one of Betty Grable’s legs! What was I talking about?

This adventure. Yeah. Did you see the cover? I didn’t know hallucinogens that strong even existed. Holy freakin’ cow dung on skateboard. You should see it. Gaze upon the madness. Gaze!

And here’s where it gets horrible, where my reality and my nightmares twist into some terrible pretzel of madness. I have that horse! On the cover. She’s in my house!

It’s just … I can’t … I can’t think about this. So take it. Take your adventure with the ponies and Amish and war buggies, and you go play it. It’s a Mission, they tell me! It’s real, they tell me! Do what you want with it. I gotta lie down.

User summary:
Although this was publisher for free on April 1st, this is a completely legit Missions adventure, able to be downloaded and run. It's a bit goofy, but also perfectly valid within the Shadowrun world.

176050.name: Ferienwanderung durch unsere Republik
176050.description: The roundtrip starts and ends in East-Berlin. Movement ist determined by a die. If a player gets on a blue space, he has to use the detour. On a red space (city) the player misses a turn. The last player to arrive in East-Berlin, wins the game.

176051.name: Gnome
176051.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

176052.name: Dungeons on Demand: Volume One
176052.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first volume of Dungeons on Demand includes everything:

Bandit's Nest - Level 1 Adventure Dungeon
Insidious Experiments - Level 4 Adventure Dungeon
Fierce Tempers - Level 8 Adventure Dungeon
Lord of Gloomthrone - Level 12 Adventure Dungeon
Random Magic Item Tables - Gaming Supplement
New Twists on Old Monsters - Gaming Supplement
Imbued with Magic - Gaming Supplement

176053.name: Magic Item Tables
176053.description:
From publisher blurb:

This spreadsheet lists all of the magic items in the Dungeon Master’s Guide by rarity, allowing you to generate random magic items that’s level appropriate for your players much more easily than the treasure tables presented in the rulebook. The spreadsheet is submitted in Open Office and Excel formats.

176054.name: Phoenix: The Terrible Valley of Static
176054.description:
From publisher blurb:

Under the burning sun, one of the hottest places in the world just became a whole lot more dangerous. In early 2090, Phoenix, Arizona dropped off the map. Nobody knows how or why. Not even the people who live there. But some of them are finding out. And when they do... they're as good as dead.

Written by Origins Award Winner and Phoenix resident John Wick and David Jarvis, Phoenix, the Terrible Valley of Static pulls back the curtain on this isolated, broken city, giving you all the dirt you'll need to get involved with any of the new factions which vie for control of Phoenix.

You'll also find rules for Ghosting in Hyper Reality, new edges, hindrances, specialized gear and new cybernetics!

176055.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 88 - Aprile/Giugno 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Fenksworld - Il Pianeta delle Grazie. 2 - Nova Castilla: la città vecchia (Vetus Castilla)
Tre Sedici. La guerra non è mai stata così divertente
XXI trofeo Rill "Il miglior racconto fantastico"

176056.name: Creating New Class Options
176056.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes a campaign will have special needs for archetypes or character options not found in the existing official material. If you’re in this situation, you might want to modify one or more of the classes in the game in order to provide options for players looking for a unique twist on their characters’ abilities. However, modifying a class is not something that should be undertaken lightly, and the job requires some serious effort, playtesting, and revision to get it right. The two best ways to modify a class are to swap out some class features for different ones, and to add new to an existing class. These methods allow you to use existing mechanics as a model, while drawing upon features of other classes for inspiration.

176057.description:
The second in a series of sequel decks to the original, UK Games Expo Award Winning Lords of War games, this expansion adds a huge number of new Unit Types, new Ranks and new rules to the base game.

Alongside adding in new gameplay functions and mechanics, this expansion also introduces Moving Units to the Elves and Lizardmen Factions.

The first of the major new Unit Types included in this expansion are Magic Units, capable of buffing allies and damaging foes using Elemental Attacks and Spell Tokens.

The game introduces Monstrous Units - extremely tough cards with 'Monstrous Defence' which allows them to ignore low damage attacks.

Finally, the Magic and Monsters Expansion also introduce Flying Units which are only vulnerable to Ranged Units and other Flying Units.

While primarily designed as an addition to Lords of War: Elves versus Lizardmen, this expansion is also compatible with all other Lords of War Factions and adds additional Command Cards, Special Units and Elite Units to the base game.
176057.name: Lords of War: Elves versus Lizardmen 2 – The Magic and Monsters Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Lords of War:  Elves versus Lizardmen
Lords of War: Orcs versus Dwarves
Lords of War: Templars versus Undead

176058.description:
From the publisher's website:

"This new country seemed threatening and unfriendly. As they went forward the hills about them steadily rose. Here and there upon heights and ridges they caught glimpses of ancient walls of stone, and the ruins of towers: they had an ominious look."
–J.R.R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring

The scenario introduced in Across the Ettenmoors thrusts you squarely into the heart of the troll-fells, a stretch of land rumored to be riddled with Trolls. As your heroes travel deeper into this dangerous territory with the hordes of Mount Gram at their back, they know there's no path for them but forward. The hills rise, the rocky ground lies quiet under dark clouds and flashes of lightning, and your heroes press on. In this scenario, the oppressive silence is broken only intermittently by the heavy footfalls of towering, lumbering Trolls. To complete your journey through the Ettenmoors, you don't need to slay some fell rider or uncover the Dark Lord's hidden servants; you need only survive…

Fortunately, the sixty new cards in Across the Ettenmoors include more than its scenario; they also introduce a new Tactics hero, who lends versatility to your fellowship's defensive efforts, as well as three copies each of nine different player cards. These touch on several different themes simultaneously, and you'll find new Signals, Mounts, and Ents taking their place alongside new Valour effects and a Tactics side quest.
176058.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Across the Ettenmoors
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Across the Ettenmoors Nightmare Deck
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Lost Realm
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

176059.name: Nocturn
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 038 – Jamaica vs Thunder Alley vs Race! Formula 90
TRCP Launch Episode 6
176059.description:
Nocturn is a game that combines two genres — strategy and horror. It takes place in the underworld where players take control over one of the nations struggling to survive among the dead realm. Players establish Houses and grant them lands, obtaining more Lords for their wars and intrigues. Through these Houses they also call armies or build mighty cities and strongholds for their nations. Their goals are simple: expanding borders and finally subjugating each other. During the gameplay the fifth player will lead diffrent force. Death, the original sovereign of the realm. In an attempt to recapture his lands, now lost to the living, he will pose a major threat to all the other players.

Easy to play/Difficult to master

The game can be played using Short Campaign rules (for 3 players, game time ~150 min) or Long Campaign rules (for 4-5 players, game time ~180-240 min). The basics of Nocturn are simple to learn and a game can start even with only one person fmailiar with rulebook and other players having only general idea about it. Gameplay favors not the players who blindly memorize all the rules but rather those who can scheme and think outside the box.

The possibilities on how to play Nocturn are only up to player imagination.
As a player you can shut your nation inside a massive well defended valley surrounded by the mountains, waiting for an outside world to degrade into chaos. You can play as an agressor, focusing on conquering other players cities and strongholds while building few yourself. Or if you want to scheme in darkness, submit early in the game to the neigbour and deceive stronger players while engaging in secret actions destabilizing the world everywhere but in your lands. Still, you have to remember the World is constantly evolving around you with each passing turn. It may happen that your well devised plan will crumble - your Court taken by other stronger player, forcing you to wonder around with few loyal troops left, selling your services to whoever would give you a glimpse of hope.

Nocturn is played for 10 turns. Each consists of three Phases:

1) Darkness Phase
During this phase Rulers ressurect their dead Lords.
– Death plays Darkness Cards and Omen Cards (Long Campaign).

2) Action Phase
During this phase players, one after another, execute actions using their Action Tokens.
Available actions for them are:
-Moving Lords of the chosen House,
-Building up to 2 new Fiefdoms,
-Developing existining Fiefdom,
-Collecting Tributes form Houses,
-Calling Lords to arms,
-Buying new Technologies.

3) Siege Phase
During this phase, players may assault besieged enemy strongholds or relieve allied ones.

176060.name: Bret Airborne
176060.description:
Bret Airborne shakes up the standard match-3 formula with strategic gameplay and original game mechanics.

Play as the intrepid Bret Airborne and help Doctor Altus to fight his evil twin brother in the challenging single-player campaign. Customize your balloon by choosing among fourty unique powers.

Source: The Game Website.

176061.name: Through the Aegis: Developed Covenants
176061.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The covenant is the heart of an Ars Magica saga. It hides secrets within its Aegis, secrets that may, across the ages, become hidden even from its own members. From the poverty and enthusiasm of Spring, through the glory of Summer, to the stability and power of Autumn, and thence to the decline of Winter, which may turn again to the flowering of Spring. There's No Place Like Home. Building a covenant from scratch can be a lot of work for players, as well as magi, so this book provides five fully detailed covenants, one for each season from Spring to Second Spring, each set in a different Tribunal. Whether you use the covenants as a base for your characters, as rivals, or just plunder the library to stock your own, this book is full of material ready for use in your saga.

176062.name: Qalidar: Resistance RolePlaying Game - Basic
176062.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Explore the multiverse of Qalidar, a crumbling cosmos full of nightmares and conspiracies. This fast, d20-based role-playing game contains a complete scenario, pre-generated characters, and all the rules you need to play the game up to fifth level. In addition to the quick start materials, this book contains character creation rules, information on traveling through the Storm and exploring the Spiral, and even more aliens and creatures.

176063.description:
Dark Gothic: Curse of the Werewolf Game Supplement is a 15-card expansion for the Dark Gothic deck-building game that introduces a new "Werewolf's Curse" Secret card, which is similar to the Dark Secret cards from the main game but acquired in new ways. You can contract the new curse from a totem or a deadly face-off with a lycanthrope.

This expansion consists of seven cards to shuffle into the main deck and eight werewolf's curse secrets.
176063.name: Dark Gothic: Curse of the Werewolf Game Supplement

176064.name: The Great Ace Attorney
176064.description:
User Summary

The Great Ace Attorney is not part of the main-numbered Ace Attorney title, it's the start of a new series.

176065.name: GURPS Zombies: Day One
176065.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Where Did All These Zombies Come From?

Zombie geeks love to argue about runners vs. shamblers, and whether zombies are defined by mindless behavior or strictly by flesh-eating, infectiousness, and undeath. The topic is nuanced enough that you could tell a new zombie story each day. The catch is that gamers expect a campaign to last a bit longer than that. Which is where GURPS Zombies: Day One comes in.

Day One sketches out eight zombie scenarios in broad strokes, looking at genre, backdrop, theme, scope, and power level – and of course zombie type. In each case, it recommends what parts of GURPS Zombies are worth keeping and what's best discarded for a coherent story. The result is an octet of densely packed campaign seeds:

Empire of the Necromancer-King offers a fantasy realm overrun by cursed zombies. It certainly feels like an apocalypse, but the heroes must battle the hordes using swords and spells, not chainsaws and shotguns.
Fields of Fear conceals dark doings in a town in the Antebellum South. You don't need a global onslaught of infectious ghouls to be very afraid. In fact, it isn't the zombies you need to worry about . . .
Savage Streets rips a page from today's news to bring you a city held hostage by drug-crazed, face-eating maniacs. Go ahead – tell them they're not real zombies!
Zeta Force assumes that almost every kind of zombie exists and then casts the PCs in the role of "Men in Black" tasked with keeping the world safe without revealing the truth.
Ultimate Zombie-Fighters jumps right into a video-game-style apocalypse in progress. Wrap your fists, grab your katana, load your shotgun, and get ready to rack up a body count!
Alpha and Omega puts the heroes in the zombies' place . . . sort of. Would you want super-powers if the price were to become a hideous, hunted outcast living in humanity's dying days?
Time of the Zombies starts where most zombie stories end: after society's destruction. Scrounge around in the ruins and rebuild, but be careful – worse things than zombies lurk out there.
Depravity Well crashes brave space voyagers on a world that unleashed the wrong nanotech. Can a handful of brave women and men hold out against a whole planet of immortal flesh-eaters?
No matter what kinds of zombies you prefer or how mighty you like your heroes to be, there's something here for everyone!

176066.name: Namariel Legends: Iron Lord
176066.description:
Playing for the daughter of the ruler of prosperous country deposed by cruel Iron Lord Namariel, the player has to escape from the air prison, find major prophet in the magical forest, reveal the secret of the Iron Lord. Get into his citadel and release Namariel from cruel tyrant.

Source: The Developer Website.

176067.name: Lilly and Sasha: Curse of the Immortals
176067.description:
After Sasha is fooled into placing her hand on an ancient shrine, her twin sister Lilly starts noticing a new darker side to her that she has never seen before. After discovering that Sasha's body is slowly being possessed by the immortal Zahhak, Lilly must furiously try to save her!

If she fails, she will have to watch as the infinite power of an immortal lays claim to the world once more in Lilly and Sasha: Curse of the Immortals.

Source: The Developer Website.

176068.description:
Designer Uwe Rosenberg has a talent for dreaming up new and inventive card games, and Mamma Mia! is a perfect example of this talent, with players placing pizza ingredients into a combined pool, then trying to time their pizza baking in order to make use of what's available in the kitchen.

Each player starts the game with eight different pizza orders to fill, with one of those order cards in hand; each player also starts with a hand of ingredient cards (showing pepperoni, mushroom, pineapple, green pepper or olive). On a turn, a player lays down one or more ingredient cards of a single type into a common stack, then optionally adds a pizza order card to that stack. He then refills his hand by drawing as many cards as he played from either the shared ingredient deck or his own order deck.

After the draw pile is exhausted, the shared pile of cards is flipped over and sorted by ingredients until an order comes up. If enough ingredient cards are available to fill that order, the owner scores it; if not, the player can make up the difference by playing cards from his hand (and thereby scoring the order) or else return the card to the bottom of his order deck.

Once all the orders are scored or returned, shuffle the ingredients used in pizzas and start another round of play. After three complete rounds, the player who's filled the most orders wins!

It includes a promotional expansion consisting of 10 double ingredient cards, two in each of the five ingredients.

During game set-up, the double ingredient cards are substituted into the deck in place of two ingredients of each type. For game play, a double ingredient is handled exactly the same as the single ingredients, but of course count as two ingredients of that kind.

If an ingredient is needed to complete an order, double ingredients on display must be used first. If necessary, a player must overpay, which also applies to double ingredients played from the hand to complete an order.
176068.name: Mamma Mia! con Ingredientes dobles

176069.description:
This expansion introduces the 'Collection' variant and includes 12 new cards and artwork.

COLLECTION VARIANT:

Each Collections set is in pairs. At the beginning of a game, you shuffle the Collections deck and then deal out all of the cards evenly to each player. You keep your collection secret from all other players. At the end of a turn that you did NOT add cards to your Hoard you may 'Trade' with another player like so:

- Choose one of your own collection cards and set it aside.
- Choose a player and draw one of their collection cards at random, adding it to your collection.
- Give that player the collection card you set aside.

When The Crown is drawn to end the game everyone turns over all of their collection cards. For each pair that a player has they are awarded 3 additional points.
176069.name: JunKing: Mini Expansion

176070.description:
Magic Realm Light 30 (MRL30) is a light, solo version of Magic Realm (by Richard Hamblen) which can be played in about 30 minutes on a single A4 printed play-sheet.

The goal is to provide anyone curious enough about Magic Realm a taste of delving to the intricacies of exploring and fighting in the realm. Players can also use this mini-game to learn about the basic rules and gameplay of the original Magic Realm.

The gameplay closely follows the original Magic Realm, with Birdsong (Planning), Daylight (Action), Evening (Combat) and Midnight (Reset) phases. Monster spawning and Movement is simplified to cater for the self-drawn map. Combat closely follows the original Magic Realm rules when playing solo. Hiring followers and using magic is also covered.

Light 30 is a Magic Realm game term, meaning "something Light-weight that takes up 30 units of time".
176070.name: Magic Realm Light 30

176071.description:
For the 10th year anniversary of Sitting Ducks Gallery a Deluxe Edition of the game has been designed, adding unique ducks, introducing hilarious new action cards and with new mechanics to modify the gameplay. These increase the ability to have more players and include all of these great additional cards to the game with hilarious references and images by Randy Martinez.

Sitting Ducks Gallery is a hysterically fun, stick-it-to-your-neighbor, line manipulation game invented by Keith Meyers. Sitting Ducks is reminiscent of the classic carnival-style, midway shooting galleries, where players are trying to take out as many ducks as possible. Players move ducks and targets, take aim, and eventually eliminate other players’ ducks using a variety of humorous Action Cards, while trying to keep their own safe. The goal is to be the last duck in the pond!

HOW TO PLAY

In Sitting Ducks, each player gets their own group of ducks. Those ducks are shuffled together and form the Duck Deck, which then become the Duck line.

The Duck line is always in flux - when a Duck is removed; the other ducks move forward to fill the gap. Certain cards can move the line forward, backwards or rearrange ducks in the line in your favor or your opponents. With the right cards, players may also move and manipulate targets to try to keep their own Ducks safe.

Eventually, you’ll get caught snoozing and you will surely lose some of your ducks.

Lose all of your ducks, and you can no longer win the game. But, one of the most fun aspects of Sitting Ducks is when all of your ducks have been eliminated from the game. Although you won’t win, you’ll still get a chance to exact revenge on the opponents who took you out and play Action Cards for the rest of the game! The last player to have a duck in the water is the winner!
176071.name: Sitting Ducks Deluxe
boardgamepodcastepisode: TRCP Launch Episode 7
TRCP Sunday Fund Day Episode 4

176072.name: Champions of Hara: Deluxe Supporter Pack
176072.description:
The deluxe edition includes three new Champions, new 25-card "Chaos" deck to allow co-op play and other additional components.

The world of Hara has descended into chaos. As the Conflux begins, Hara’s primal sources of energy rage out of control, threatening to tear the world apart. In a last-ditch effort to save it, Hara’s stewards send a call throughout the universe, drawing on Champions— individuals capable of containing this energy— and offering the promise of untold glory. However, only one Champion can bring the world of Hara back into balance and earn its power for him or herself.

In Champions of Hara, you’ll take control of one such individual. Journey across the shifting planes of Hara; forging fragile alliances, battling epic monsters, and facing off against friends and foes alike. As you do, you’ll unlock new powers and abilities to help you on your journey. But beware… as the Conflux grows more intense, the monsters you face will get tougher, the world will get harsher, and the planes that make up Hara itself will shift. Do you have what it takes to stand up to the challenge?

Do you have what it takes to become a Champion?

Gameplay:
You are a Champion, and your mission is to contain Hara's three wayward energies.

To do so, you'll have to defeat monsters, close rifts, and explore the six shifting planes of Hara.

As you do, you will be rewarded with energy cubes which you can use to unlock the three Elemental Attunements, and gain new powers and abilities.

Along the way, you'll have to manage your hand, actions and a unique Energy Alignment system to get the most out of every turn and take on the toughest challenges.

If you can, you'll be well on your way to containing all three elemental energies, and winning the game!

176073.name: Aftermath: The Newcomers
176073.description:
Expansion to Aftermath: The Beginning

Includes:

16 new Publicity cards
16 new Objective cards
4 new Character cards
80 Influence tokens (20 for each new character)

176074.name: Aftermath: The Beginning – Kickstarter Exclusive Characters
176074.description: The Gambler and The Sailor character cards are exclusive for backers of the base game on Kickstarter. Each character comes with its own set of 20 influence tokens.

176075.name: #Harshmode Monday (#21 - Mar 30, 2015)
176075.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every Monday the creative team from Harsh Realities will offer up small pdf documents to showcase the vast capability of the Sixcess game mechanic!

Each #Harshmode Monday will feature an NPC, Creature, Location, Adventure Seed, or any number of other interesting and useful bits for your gaming table!

176076.name: Bonanza
176076.description:
Michigan Rummy game, looks similar to Tripoley, but instead of 10-J-Q-K-A of Hearts (5 spots), 8-9-10 all one suit (one spot), Q-K of Hearts (one spot), and the Kitty, the spots are


Jack of Clubs
Queen of Diamonds
King of Hearts
Ace of Spades
Joker
Queen of Spades/Jack of Diamonds
Sequence
Ten of Diamonds/Two of Spades
Poker



Game play:

Give each player a quantity of chips. Each player must then place one chip of the same denomination on each of the ten spaces on the Bonanza wheel. Deal the cards one at a time beginning at the dealer's left and dealing one extra hand as a "widow." Continue dealing until the pack is exhausted, regardless of the fact that some of the players will receive an extra card.

The players examine their cards. The dealer, without looking at the "widow," chooses either to discard his hand in exchange for it or to keep his hand and sell the "widow" to the highest bidder. If he announces that the "widow" is for sale, the other players, without looking at it, may bid for it if they choose, the bidding starting at the dealer's left and continuing around the table as many times as necessary to determine the highest bidder. The successful bidder gives the dealer the number of chips bid, discards his original hand, and picks up the "widow." If the dealer offers the "widow" for sale and no one bids, it is discarded.

The play of the hand falls into two parts, the first on the upper half of the wheei (Joker, Queen-Jack, Sequence, Ten-Two, and Poker) and the second on the lower half (Ace of Spades, King of Hearts, Queen of Diamonds, Jack of Clubs, and Center Section).

VALUE OF POKER HANDS

Poker hands are ranked as such:

1. Royal Straight Flush - Ace, King, Queen, Jack, Ten. All one suit.
2. Straight Flush - 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 (or any other sequence except Royal Flush) all one suit.
3. Four of a Kind.
4. Full House - Three of a kind and one pair.
5. Flush - All one suit, but not necessarily in any sequence.
6. STRAIGHT - 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 (or any other sequence) and cards of two or more different suits.
7. Three of a Kind.
8. Two Pairs.
9. One Pair.

176077.name: Baa Baa
176077.description:
A simple colour matching game with spinner-based play by Orchard Toys.

Each player takes a field board with six coloured spots on it. Players then take it in turns to spin. If a colour matching a spot on their board comes up, they take a sheep stand-up wearing that colour and place it on the appropriate spot on their board.

The player who fills their board with six sheep first is the winner.

There is a wildcard spot on the spinner, allowing players to choose the colour themselves.

From the back of the box:
"Can you be the first to collect all of your sheep?
Gather your flock in this fun colour matching game for young players!"

176078.name: Stickmen: Basic Doodle Adventures
176078.description:
In the margins...

In the wide and empty spaces of a High School Chemistry students spiral notebook (that was supposed to be used for note-taking), a few strong and hastily drawn doodles have come to explore and live out there lives on the page. But across the emptiness, environments, obstacles and countless crudely drawn enemies are being written in.

Can you and your friends traverse this 2D world and survive?

What kind of adventure will you be a part of?

And will this child ever run out of ink!?

No really...?

Stickmen: Basic Doodle Adventures is a small pick-up-and-play “Party Role-Playing Game” about platforming, creating funny little stick figures, and constant exploration. In hopes of getting off the page alive, and safely onto the next.

This game is great for introducing children to Role-Playing, light-weight enough for short games at parties, and has enough room to grow that some may find depth within the line segments.

With features like: 30 second Character Creation, No planning needed, being easy to learn, and pureComedy GOLD!

176079.name: Amethyst Rules-Lite Role-Playing
176079.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Hey there and thanks for checking out Amethyst Role-Playing! The generic system where you can pick up and play in almost no time at all! With its creative rules of play, as well as the modular style of the Core Rules, you and your group can play watever genre you want!

Amethyst:RP is based upon the idea of Player input to create an interesting story, so the GM can focus on fleshing out an idea, not creating one. This is done through play-sets or game supplements that are separate from the Core Rules. These supplements are not supplements at all, they are an extension of the Core Rules! So that if you wanted to play a Supernatural game of Investigation, grab that play-set!

But Players are not limited to just what we offer for play-sets! There will be rules on creation of play-sets as well (in an update coming soon)!

So get ready for any kind of fun you can imagine, in a world where the Game-Master doesn't need to work so hard."

176080.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Cantal region, in France.
176080.name: Monopoly: Cantal

176081.description:
In the hot and humid swamps of Jargono, primitive bands of Humans and savage Serpentmen build their civilizations on the ancient ruins of those who came before. Filled with ancient ceremonial relics and brutal Dark Stone-edged weapons, the jungle is home to many artifacts worth uncovering. This 15 card supplement adds a collection of all new Swamps of Jargono Artifacts for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around the primitive but brutal Dark Stone weapons used by the tribal Humans and Serpentmen of Jargono as well as lost relics and medicines native to the murky swamps.

A collection of 15 Artifact cards for use with the Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death core set. Roughly doubles the number of artifacts available for the Jargono Otherworld.


Bogbat Ichor x2
Terri-Terri Leaf x2
Dark Stone Club x2
Sacrificial Dagger
Totem of De'nar
Hunting Net
Statue of a Serpent God
Stone Tablet
Swamp Parasite
Se'Parri Flute
Tribal Armor
Trophy Shield
176081.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Jargono Artifacts Supplement
boardgameexpansion: Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death

176082.description:
In the frozen over Targa Plateau, many relics of the past are buried in the ice… left dormant by the alien inhabitants of this once great city. These artifacts and technological wonders have been lost for eons, waiting to be discovered, and reactivated. This 15 card supplement adds a collection of all new Targa Plateau Artifacts for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around ancient alien technology and the lost terrors preserved in the ice for millennia.

A collection of 15 Artifact cards for use with the Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients core set. Roughly doubles the number of artifacts available for the Targa Plateau Otherworld.


Warp Crystals x2
Holo Recording x2
Experiment Canister x2
Isolation Field
Shadow Bracelet
Cryo Pistol
Plasma Sword
Gate Rifle
Trun Gladius
Control Crystal
Ancient Tablet
Dark Orb
176082.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Targa Artifacts Supplement
boardgameexpansion: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients

176083.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the fast-paced and morbidly kitschy game Hit Z Road, you and your fellow players embark on a road trip going south from Chicago along America's famous Route 66 — now infested by zombies. As you travel though a deck of adventure cards rife with dangers, you battle zombie hordes, drive abandoned school buses, scavenge for gas and bullets, and explore a darkened, tainted American countryside full of shambling undead, haunted carnivals, and plumes of toxic gas. Your goal is to stay alive until you reach the safe, sandy beaches of the California coast.

Three different stages of adventure cards create an experience of increasing difficulty and ensure that each playthrough is unique. Each round begins with an auction that determines both player order and which cards you will encounter. Since the resources used for bidding are the same as those used to battle the oncoming zombie hordes, your survival depends as much on your resource management as it does upon winning those bidding wars. The player who either accumulates the most points or survives the longest wins.

Zombies of all types await, with cannibals, anti-personnel mines and radioactive wastes also being among the hazards awaiting the players. Who will survive the zombie onslaught?
176083.name: Hit Z Road
boardgamepodcastepisode: 9. Devon Dice Podcast - The Gallerist Review  and more
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 025 – Gen Con 2016
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 026 – Random Top 10 Games
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 035 – Top 25 of 2016
DJ134: Hit Z Road (2016) Martin Wallace
Episode 25 - GenCon Recap!!
Episode 59 - Hit Z Road
Episode 79- Junk Art and GenCon 2016, CONTEST!
HLG 10: Meer Essen
The Game Pit: Episode 69 - Picking Over the Bones

176084.name: Monopoly: Groningen
176084.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Groningen, in the Netherlands.
note:
big part of the profit was donated to charity foundation Beatrix children's hospital.

176085.name: Get Out Alive
176085.description: Get out Alive is a card game where you find yourself in an abandoned building with instructions saying only the first person to escape will live. Not remembering why or how you got there, you plan your escape.

176086.name: Welcome to the Nebula California
rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG
176086.description:
From the Introduction:

Explorer's Report: California Nebula is a special setting companion set in the far fringes of the BattleTech setting, presenting unique new worlds and environs that may be used to spice up your BattleTech campaigns, whether they are role-playing adventures using the rules found in A Time of War (AToW), or the tactical combat rules found in Total Warfare (TW) and Alpha Strike (AS).

Of course, given the fact that we are releasing this puppy on the first of April, a day we tend to reserve for mischief, it should be obvious to all that the material and rules presented in this electronic volume are provided purely in the interests of fun, and may be considered non-canon. No, really; as much as we would love to claim that what you find inside this book is really happening in the BattleTech universe, it's really not.

[Author's Note: Well, actually, it could all be canon; we’re not sure. It seems that something surrounds the California Nebula that allows JumpShips in, but prevents them from leaving its boundaries. These poor IE folks you'll be hearing from? They can jump out any time they want, but they can never leave! It's a real wonder how their reports are even making it into your hands, in fact... Are you a spy or something?]

[Developer's Note: The developers would like to apologize for the author's rant above! Rest assured, that he is clearly delusional, and will be sacked. Nothing to see here! Move along!]

Anyway, canon or no, basic rules covering the use and effectiveness of the technologies, techniques, and equipment for your BattleTech games can be found at the back of this volume. As unconventional as they might be, they may be introduced to games based on the core rules found in TW, TO, AToW, and their various companions. For the benefit of players who concern themselves which such things, the data for all of the featured units and material in this book are the very definition of Experimental-level rules, regardless of their era of play.

[Writer's Note: Even future eras?]

[Developer's Note: Especially future eras! Now, go box your stuff!]

So, you know, read on and have fun!

176087.name: Mega Kisses: Adventures in Fandom
176087.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mega Kisses is a world like ours, with one major difference: Manga Cafes offer gateways to strange and fantastical worlds that look a lot like real world fandoms. These places have problems, and your characters, Megas, are there to solve them.

It's a little bit Power Rangers, a little bit Sliders, a little bit Sailor Moon, a little bit Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court, a little bit EVERYTHING. Imagination's the limit in these strange genre worlds. Mega Kisses uses Fate Core, and builds off it. To play, you'll need access to Fate Core, or the free Fate Core SRD.

Mega Kisses is a full fleshed Fate Core hack. It tweaks and twists the rules for optimal geeky and genki goodness.
It introduces Principles to play in these strange genre realms.
It offers simple, targeted character creation for making your nerdy, otaku Megas.
Then, it offers rules and Milestones for shifting your characters from world to world and letting their geeky hobbies influence their abilities.




There are two kinds of people in the world of Mega Kisses.

There’s most people, and there’s people who have been through café wormhole. Anyone can be a Mega, but most people would never believe it. Most people would ignore a wormhole right in front of them. A Mega will walk, run, or even fall in. But a Mega will go through, and a mundane won’t.

boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
176088.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Graubünden (Grisons), a canton in Switzerland.
note: bilingual edition, German & 'Grisons' (Rumantsch Grischun),
a regional language
176088.name: Monopoly: Graubünden

boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
176090.description:
