Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the FC St. Gallen, a soccer club in Switzerland
176090.name: Monopoly: FC St. Gallen

176091.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Granada, a city in Spain
176091.name: Monopoly: Granada

176092.name: Guest Stars
176092.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mini-supplement to support playing one-shot appearances, whether for players who can only appear for one Episode, or for return players to try something new.

This is a supplement for the World Wide Wrestling Roleplaying Game. This mini-supplement was made possible by the members of the WWWRPG Google+ Community.

Introducing:

Six "Guest Star" Roles, designed to pick-up-and-play, and each bringing their own brand of excitement to your promotion:

The Special Referee
The Ring Announcer
The Celebrity Guest
The Company Executive
The Audience Plant
The Special Host




A new Advanced Role, The Part-Timer. The Part-Timer "retired" but just can't quit the business. Back to work a specific program, will the Part-Timer's creative control clause enable a legendary victory lap or a forgettable nostalgia run?

176093.description:
The deserts and mines near the ruins of Brimstone are harsh and unforgiving, made only more so by the cutthroat and backstabbing nature of the outlaws and gangs that reside there. Often times, one man’s treasure is another man’s dead body. This 15 card supplement adds a collection of all new Gear for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around items found on the bodies of outlaws and prospectors betrayed by their companions and left for dead.

15 new Gear cards for use with Shadows of Brimstone. Themes include the Dead Man's equipment, items useful for fighting undead, and new outlaw-specific gear. There's also a new mining lantern that lets you spend grit to reroll the "hold back the darkness" roll.


Dead Man’s Boots x2
Canteen x2
Sawed-Off Shotgun x2
Dead Man’s Vest
Dead Man’s Dice
Dead Man’s Buckle
Mining Lantern
Gold Teeth
Rusty Badge
Outlaw’s Gun Belt
Jack of Hearts
Bandana
176093.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Dead Man's Bounty Supplement
boardgameexpansion: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death

176094.name: The Camp Bloodshed Trilogy: Part Two
176094.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Camp Bloodshed Trilogy (Part Two) is the sequel to the top-selling Slasher Flick adventure of all time. It takes place 24 years after the events of the first installment. Since that time, the massacre at Camp Bastion has faded into the realm of local legend and now, the brothers and sisters of a fraternity and sorority are forcing their new pledges to spend the night at the infamous camp. Will they survive the night or will history repeat itself?

The Camp Bloodshed Trilogy (Part Two) is the second of three flicks (aka adventures) that collectively represent a trilogy of movies. The gory thrills continue right here, so prepare yourself for all the twists and turns to come.

176095.name: The Crimson Void
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
176095.description:
From publisher blurb:

CE 6: The Crimson Void describes a unique goddess (Kala Môr), Her cult, temple grounds, as well as the priests and other beings associated with the location. The easiest way to use this material is to allow PC clerics of Kala Môr attached to this temple. Kala Môr may also be used as a template for creating unique deities of the judge’s own devising. Other characters may oppose the temple, come to it for aid, attempt to prevent a sacrifice, or need to leap into the Crimson Void themselves. Robbing the temple of its riches would be a crowning achievement for any thief. A Neutral deity was chosen to allow the judge to easily use Kala Môr as both aid and adversary to any group as he chooses.

A setting element to help create a rich campaign environment for DCC games of all levels.

176096.description:
The vastness of the cosmos and the Void between space and time are home to treasures unimaginable to the Human mind. Sometimes these magical forces are bound within amulets and rings by unknown intelligence with a mastery of sorcery too dark and terrible to contemplate, deposited into the real world to corrupt and ensnare lesser beings who would dare to use them. This 15 card supplement adds a collection of all new Mine Artifacts for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around lost treasures and magical relics from the Void and other worlds beyond.

15 new Artifacts for use with Shadows of Brimstone. Includes a variety of enchanted jewelry, several items that do Corruption Hits to you in trade for some other benefit, a new Lantern that uses Peril Dice to Hold Back The Darkness, and two copies of an item that can heal Mutations or remove Parasites.


Vial of Brimstone Ash x2
Jewel of the Void x2
Hell Bullets x2
Void Lantern
Ring of Corruption
Hellfire Ring
Void Ring
Trederran Trench Pistol
Void Hound Tooth
Amulet of Bâlorn
Amulet of Trondo
Tome of Ro’kal
176096.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Treasures of the Void Game Supplement
boardgameexpansion: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death

176097.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Real Madrid, a famous Soccer Club in Spain
176097.name: Monopoly: Real Madrid

176098.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from FC Barcelona, a famous Soccer Club in Spain
176098.name: Monopoly: FC Barcelona

176099.name: Elemental
176099.description:
Elemental is a strategic board game of simultaneous action and hidden information. Players assume control of either the light mage or the dark mage and control 7 elementals in a duel. The elementals--water, fire, earth, wind, frost, bolt, and light/dark--interact in a 5-way rock-paper-scissors system. Each of them is equally strong, given the right circumstances. The goal of the game is simple: either defeat or isolate your opponent's light/dark elemental.

The trick is that you can only find out your opponent's pieces by battle or deduction. Each player will be trying to gather information while cutting losses and revealing as little as possible. Elementals can sustain 2 hits, allowing players to take calculated risks and control an area with a bluffed piece.

The arena itself plays into the deduction process with its fountains (which provide tantalizing bonuses for matching elementals) and its energy wells (which generate crystals for special one-time maneuvers). Once the player has deduced their opponent’s strengths and weaknesses, they can take command of the arena and lead their elementals to victory.

The Print and Play is available here: Elemental Print and Play
Note that the print and play is meant to convert an old set of checkers and 2 D6. As such, the lightning elemental is not included in this version, as that would require 4 more pieces than the standard checkers set.

176100.name: Bloom: The Role-Playing Game
176100.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bloom is a feature film in which Lily (Deann Baker) wakes up in a bloody motel bathroom with fuzzy memories of the previous night. As she copes with her trauma and struggles to figure out what happened, she begins changing into something inhuman.

The Bloom Role-Playing Game, published in association with Aegis Studios, allows players to step into the world of Bloom and explore the themes introduced in the film.

176101.name: Shadows in Focus: Sioux Nation - Starving the Masses
176101.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Half-Step from Chaos

If there’s anything shadowrunners have learned over and over again, it’s that the veneer of civilization coating much of the world is extremely thin (in the Barrens, of course, it’s non-existent). There are so many tensions in the Sixth World that altering the delicate balances just a hair or two can bring chaos and conflict to areas that had previously managed to scrape together a peaceful appearance.

If you want to cause that chaos, all that’s needed is a little gentle pressure on one of the essential arteries that keeps civilization alive. And no artery is as susceptible to this pressure as the food supply.

Stripped of a lucrative position and exiled from his family, Theo Two-Hearts has a score to settle, and he’s going to take it out on the entire Sioux Nation. Like many vengeance-minded people before him, he’s turned to shadowrunners to do his dirty work. If they sign on to his plan, they’re going to confront some of the toughest forces the Sioux Nation can throw at them. The first bit of chaos they create will rain down on them—if they survive, much more will follow.

Starving the Masses is an adventure that is part of the Shadows in Focus: Sioux Nation series for Shadowrun, Fifth Edition. It can be played alone, or the Sioux Nation and Cheyenne books can be used to add more richness and details to a challenging run!

176102.name: Vestraadi
176102.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Underworld in Aventyr is filled with unique races, but the vestraadi are in a world all their own. This brand new player race for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game is blind, but they see far more than you’d expect! Read on about the Forever Deep, Song Spheres, and so much more!

In Underworld Races: Vestraadi you’ll find...

a brand new aquatic player race totally unique from all others!
sonar rules for a new approach to blindness in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game!
favored class options for PCs of any occupation!
new gear—sponged undercoral and underslick!
Intuitive Dodge, Preternatural Hearing, Unnatural Appearance and more new feats!
new magic items like whim of the Current and the resonating bow!
pressure of the Forever Deep and more new spells!
the vestraadi argus paragon class for adventurers that yearn to see it all!

176103.description: Shogun Big Box includes the base game of Shogun, Tenno's Court Expansion 1, Samurai Expansion Module 2, Military Leaders Expansion Module 3 and Chambers Expansion Module 4.
176103.name: Shogun Big Box
boardgamepodcastepisode: 제102-b회 게임 대 게임 - 발렌슈타인 vs. 쇼군

176104.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Another version of the classic Monopoly. This time the cases represent Celtic Glasgow.
176104.name: Monopoly: Celtic Football Club Edition

176105.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Another version of the classic Monopoly. This time the cases represent the soccer team Glasgow Rangers.
176105.name: Monopoly: Rangers Football Club

176106.description:
An Ameritrash, push-your-luck pirate game where players use a hand of Action cards (swords/sails/cannons) to gain as much Treasure and Infamy as possible! Sailing around a series of islands on a cloth map, players encounter ports, other players, and X's where Treasure may be buried.

There are a variety of Treasures to possess and Infamy tokens to be gained by fighting pirates and ports or completing various Quests.

The game plays in rounds, with each player receiving up to 8 random Action cards. They may Sail, Pillage, Board other ships, Shoot other ships, and/or Dig or Bury Treasure. Using their Action cards they may do as many of these actions as desired during their turn if they have the necessary cards. But players don't draw new cards until the end of the round. Bidding at the end of each round allows players to compete for who goes first, and which direction play moves.

When 2 pirates are dead (the first player to die remains in the game as the ghost pirate), all the Treasure cards have been pillaged, OR any Quests are complete, the game ends. The player with the most Infamy points (Tokens and Treasure) wins!
176106.name: Scoundrels
boardgamepodcastepisode: TRCP Launch Episode 8

176107.name: The Falling Sun
176107.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

The Falling Sun is set in late WW2 Burma. You play a young British officer tasked with discovering the fate of an armoured division.

176108.description:
Masters of Football is a unique board game in which you are a club manager who needs to deal with all aspects of “the beautiful game”, inside and outside the pitch. Your objective is to win the championship !

You will have to manage your budget and build your team from scratch, as well as fight for the 3 points in each match by taking control of the team for attack and defence, picking the best tactics and using every trick in the book to win the championship.

Multiple different managers, unique players and versatile action cards (strategy, evolution, anti-football and the dreaded corruption cards) make every game different.

Masters of Football uses a match mechanism based on a custom dice algorithm that keeps the results realistic according to the teams strengths with just the right amount of unpredictability, also designed to allow a fast pace during matches.
176108.name: Masters of Football

176109.name: Die!
176109.description:
In Die! you are trying not to die; however, you will most likely die...quickly. Players play role cards and try to survive the other players, with a typical game lasting 1-5 minutes. Roles include:


Undertaker
Jester
Knight
King
Peasant


In more detail, each player chooses a role card, then says a secret phrase. You may lie. Players try to deduce and outguess who you are. You may also choose to sit out a round, but this option is available to you only once (via token). You can earn the token back and may live to survive another day — but most likely you'll die.

176111.name: Bountiful Booty
176111.description:
Bountiful Booty is a push-your-luck, network-building strategy game for 2 pirate captains in-training.

The board is made up of hex-tiles representing islands that players will raid each turn. By playing cards depicting those same islands, players can add an island to their network and gain treasure in the process. They will try to maintain control of as many islands as they can for as long as they can to maximize their booty.

When raiding an island players will roll their dice to see how much treasure they'll earn. If a skull is rolled they lose a die and gain no treasure.

Each player starts the game with 10 ships and 3 dice. If at any time a player can't place a ship or runs out of dice to roll they have to remove all their ships from the map and they lose all their treasure.

In the end the player with the most booty wins.

176112.name: Micro Play-Break: Duel
176112.description:
From the publisher:

In this 2-player game, the Attacker controls the field of play via Momentum, selecting one of three attack types aimed at either the upper or lower section of an opponent's character. Defenders can stop the momentum and become the attacker by successfully predicting the incoming attack and accurately selecting the correct block type and placing it where the attacker's hit would land.

How well can you predict your opponent's actions?

The Story: You are an elite TechnoLectric Warrior helping your Evil Warlord in his quest for world domination. During your standard mission of Seek and Destroy, you have come across an equally elite warrior in the employ of your Warlord’s enemy.

Both Warriors, equal in weapons and skill, make decisions during battle that will determine who survives.

176113.name: Chikuwa Soudatsu Sen
176113.description:
User summary:
ちくわ争奪戦 (Chikuwa Soudatsu Sen, literally "struggle for Chikuwa") is a card game in which the players are cats, craftily trying to get the best serving of Chikuwa fish paste at supper.

In the game, the deck has cards numbered 0, 1, 2 or 3. Players are dealt three cards each, and three more cards are placed face-down on the table. Starting with the player who's most recently had Chikuwa, each player may swap two cards from their hand with those on the table, or they may pass. Going clockwise, once each player has had their turn, the cards on the table are shuffled back into the deck, and another three are dealt face-down. Going back the other way, the players repeat their turn to swap one or two cards in their hand. Lastly, everyone shows their hand.

The aim is to get the best ranking combination of three cards. In the game, 3-3-3 is the worst of all, since you have been a greedy cat and stuffed yourself until you've got stomach-ache. 0-0-0 is the best combination, since the owners see you've been so unselfish and punish the other cats by giving you their food. But after 0-0-0, the best combo is 3-3-2, then 3-2-2, then 3-3-1 and so on, down to 1-0-0 which beats 3-3-3. So, by bluffing and guessing, can you work up to a high ranking hand, or do you risk holding 0s in the aim of winning all?

Publisher's summary:
いつも仲良しのネコ達ですが、今日のごはんにみんな大好物のちくわがご飯のため、目の色を変えて奪い合います。ただし、食べ過ぎや仲良く食べていないと大変な目にあうかもしれません。
遊び方は、とても簡単です。
スタートプレイヤーから時計回りに中央の伏せカードから最大２枚まで手札を交換し、その後シャッフルします。今度は最後の人から半時計周りに同じ事を行い3枚の数字の合計が一番高い人が勝利となります。
ただし、１番強い数字は食べ過ぎて１番弱なり、１番低い数字は仲良く食べてない事がばれ１番強くなります。

176115.description:
This is it – you've finally been called up to the big leagues. There's one open position in the homicide unit and the competition for the job is fierce. The police chief is going to give all of you, the aspiring beat cops, a couple of murder investigations to see who has what it takes to become a real detective.

Spoiler alert: All of you absolutely do not have what it takes.

But that doesn't mean you aren't going to give it your best. You've watched, like, a whole marathon of police TV shows last weekend and you think you've got the formula for justice all figured out. And if there's one thing you've learned about the criminal justice system, it's this: It doesn't matter if you're right or wrong, it just matters how good you can look in front of your boss.

Bad Detectives is a tile-based card game for 3-4 players, which takes approximately 45-60 minutes to play. Players take turns adding information to a network of Polaroid photos and strings, creating a map of the murder investigation. The players will use these strings to connect a Suspect, Weapon, and Crime Scene to the Victim. Once completed, the case is ready to go to trial.

However, solving the murder investigation is simply a means to an end. The true objective of the game is to be the detective with the most Evidence Points when the central case goes to trial. When a player adds a new card to the investigation, Evidence Points are put into play on the card as it is placed. However, these are only counted towards a player's final score if those cards are used to directly link the Victim to the most relevant Leads. To succeed, players will need to undermine the credibility of their colleagues, take creative shortcuts to justice, and put their contributions to the case in the places that matter most.
176115.name: Bad Detectives
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Dice Section 32: Bad Detectives

176121.name: Phex-Vademecum
176121.description:
user summary

A manual that provides all the information players need to add background and depth to their clerics of Phex, God of trade and cunning. It includes prayers, canticles, rituals, holy books, and other background information on the cult of Phex.

176122.name: Peraine-Vademecum
176122.description:
user summary

A manual that provides all the information players need to add background and depth to their clerics of Peraine, Goddess of agriculture and plants. It includes prayers, canticles, rituals, holy books, and other background information on the cult of Peraine.

176123.name: Schloss Strobanoff
176123.description:
From the Publisher

Gespenstische Geschichten erzählen sich die Bornländer von dem verstorbenen Abenteurer Iljan Strobanoff und seinem Schloss. Der Landsitz des alten Glücksritters gilt als verflucht und doch ist das Spukhaus ein lohnenswertes Ziel für Helden, schließlich sollen hier die Schätze seines abenteuerlichen Lebens lagern. Doch nicht nur die Helden interessieren sich für das Schloss: Auch andere Schatzsucher versuchen das Rätsel des Gebäudes zu lösen und sich zu bereichern.

Werden die Helden dem Geheimnis um Iljan Strobanoffs Hinterlassenschaften auf den Grund gehen und den Fluch brechen? Können sie sich gegen ihre Konkurrenten durchsetzen und vor ihnen die Schätze bergen? Oder wird Schloss Strobanoff vielleicht das Grab der wagemutigen Helden?

176124.name: Seelenernte
176124.description:
From the Publisher

Das Tote Land. Verdorrte, leblose Landstriche, von grauem Staub bedeckt, aus dem bleiche Knochen ragen. Brachliegende Felder, verlassene Dörfer, Boronsanger, aus deren geschändeten Gräbern sich einst die Toten zu Dutzenden wühlten, um sich dem Endlosen Heerbann anzuschließen.
Eine götterverlassene Gegend, wie es scheint, aber nicht alle Götter haben sich abgewandt: Unter den gütigen Augen der Herrin Peraine keimt das zarte Pflänzchen der Hoffnung, und langsam kehrt das Leben in die kahle Ödnis zurück.
Doch ein alter Feind spinnt in der Finsternis seine Ränke, sammelt Seelen, sät Schrecken und labt sich an Alpträumen. Die Fesseln, die ihn einst zwangen, sind brüchig geworden, und seine Macht ist größer denn je. Noch nie war er seinem Ziel so nah wie jetzt - wird die Saat der letzten Jahre aufgehen? Wer wird die Seelenernte einfahren, wenn die Nacht über das Land kommt?

Seelenernte kann direkt im Anschluss an Träume von Tod gespielt werden, eignet sich aber auch als völlig eigenständiges Abenteuer. Dieses Abenteuer ist Teil des Splitterdämmerungs-Zyklus und behandelt das Schicksal der Heptarchen und der Splitter der Dämonenkrone. Der Band kann auch vom Zyklus losgelöst gespielt werden.

176125.name: B-Daman Crossfire Surge Strike Arena
176125.description:
From the publisher’s website:

Ready...Aim...Crossfire! Can you handle your next mission in the Surge Strike Arena? Blast away with your B-Daman figure (figures sold separately) and try to lock three or more bars in the arena before your opponent does. Do you have what it takes for precision target blasting? Find out with the Surge Strike Arena. Surge Strike Arena includes a centerpiece with five Surge Strike bars. Fire at the centerpiece and lock 3 bars before your opponent does. Includes unassembled arena, 6 B-DA Marbles, collector card, label sheet, and instructions.

176126.name: Willkommen in der Hölle
176126.description:
From the Publisher

Dieses kurze Abenteuer entstand speziell für die Verwendung auf Conventions flankierend zur Veröffentlichung von Düstere Orte – dem Quellenband, der spezielle Schauplätze für Cthulhu-Abenteuer zum Kernthema macht.
Hier finden sich die Charaktere zu einer Weinprobe zusammen, die einen sehr unerquicklichen Verlauf nimmt.
Das Abenteuer kann vermutlich an einem Spielabend durchgespielt werden.
Zeit: 1920er Jahre

176127.name: B-Daman Crossfire Vertigo Spin Arena
176127.description:
From the publisher’s website:

Ready…Aim…Crossfire! Can you handle your next mission in the Vertigo Spin Arena? Blast away with your B-Daman figure (figures sold separately) and try to knock three marbles out of the arena before your opponent does. Do you have what it takes for precision target blasting? Find out with the Vertigo Spin Arena. Vertigo Spin Arena includes a centerpiece with six Vertigo Spin marble slots! Fire at the centerpiece and knock three marbles out before your opponent does. Includes unassembled arena, 6 B-DA Marbles, collector card, label sheet, and instructions.
